review_body: My daughter goes to college in Nyc . Every time we visit for the past four years we stay at the empire hotel. Great location. Right near college, Central Park , restaurants and lots of shopping.?Staff and management are fabulous. I miss nyc and our little getaways.

Located directly across the street from Lincoln Center, the Empire Hotel is a charming, friendly, convenient hotel in the thick of NYC. We were greeted immediately as we drove up, given quick directions to check-in while receiving our pickup ticket for Valet Parking. At check-in, Luis welcomed us, thanked us for coming and asked the reason for our visit. When I explained we were there to see our son's performance at the Met Opera (his first) we we congratulated and he said he'd upgrade us and gave us a room overlooking Lincoln Center Plaza.Everyone from Bellman to Maid service were friendly and professional. We will certainly return!

The Empire Hotel is ideally situated for walking distance to lots of major attractions. Central Park is virtually minutes away , the subway is also close by - and the subway allows fast transport to all areas of New York. The rooms are reasonable sized, bed was very comfortable and the staff were available when required

Absolutely loved my stay here, couldn’t have picked a fault with location / hotel etc until I arrived at the airport realisingmy airpods were gone from my bag. i did not check if my airpods were in my bag as they had not been used or left my bag in the whole time i was in NYC.I contacted the hotel and they weren’t helpful at all - airpods have been removed from Find my iPhone which after speaking to apple support means someone has them and has reset them. Extremely disappointed with the response as they were removed during my stay I would have thought the hotel may have been more helpful.We 10000% checked everywhere in the room so they were not left at all - checked under the bed and every possible place things could’ve been left.Very unhappy guest!

The location of this hotel is great! We went for a run every morning in central park and it was only a couple of mins to get to. We walked pretty much everywhere from the hotel. Our room was cosy, but that's totally to be expected in NYC, it was clean and everything functioned fine. A perfect base to explore the city from.The doormen deserve a special mention as they were always warm and welcoming.We found the rooftop bar a little fancy for us...but it might suit others better!

Amongst all the madness going on worldwide, I have to say that this hotel has continued to give ‘normal’, friendly and outstanding customer service. Tommy one of the doormen I can honestly say made my whole trip! His attitudeWas just so refreshing. Being a foreigner in NY and especially during this crisis a lot of people aren’t treating you the same as during normal periods yet our time spent with Tommy felt Asif the craziness wasn’t happening. He took us up to the Empire Hotel’s sign which unfortunately had been closed and was one of the main reasons we chose this hotel. He even took pictures of us which has been a huge challenge on this trip as no one fancy’s holding your phone! He showed us some other sites as seen on GG and just overall was lovely to speak with. Even managed to get us in the bar and have a signature “Chuck Bass” cocktail! He is honestly one of the hotels best assets. This is our first day here and I have to say will be one to remember- when everything returns to normality we will be back and most definitely returning to this hotel. Thankyou Tommy for making our trip that extra bit special :)

I stayed in the hotel for a few nights before important meetings. I wanted to make sure I could sleep early and well, and the staff was extremely accommodating to make sure that I had a quiet room. I appreciate the stay and will definitely stay again.

The location is wonderful near Lincoln Center. The lobby is beautiful, and staff is very helpful. The rooms are super small and the bathrooms are even smaller. The bathroom needed some attention with caulking and the door was warped from the moisture in the bathroom. Otherwise, everything was great! I would definitely stay there again.

Luis was great! He made the stay great, he upgraded us to a Suite with a city view for our honeymoon thanks to Luis. The room overall was great. Good location, great waitstaff. The two head shower was a nice touch. The pool area was closed, which is where the iconic Empire Hotel sign is located. The city was great and Hotel Empire was centrally located.

I’ve stayed at this hotel before the rest of my party hadn’t. We had two rooms booked for two couples. The rooms are small but more than adequate for a city, it’s what you would expect. Bathrooms are very clean but could do with a lick of paint but I’m sure it’s in the plan. We had an issue with one of the rooms and noise which was quite loud and significantly disturbed sleep, my husband popped down to reception at 7am to see if we had any options while I was getting ready and by 710am we were moved and another quieter room arranged - never known service like it! Really great stay, perfect locations for walking in the city and jumping in the subway! Stayed before, would stay again - definitely recommend ! Thanks for a great trip!

Very rude staff Small rooms they don’t face anything nice you just look at a wall overpriced breakfast management that can’t call you back or do their job worst hotel I’ve ever stayed or will never be going back to this hotel ever again they should not call at the Empire Hotel that’s an insult to the USA

Hotel is dated and in need of an upgrade, but it is not bad overall. Doormen are so friendly and helpful. Best place to stay if you are going to the opera, it's virtually across the street from the front doors.

I have stayed here before, and enjoyed it so I decided to book again. My original room was small which would normally be fine, but I'm staying for a week. Randy at the front desk was very polite, helpful, and even upgraded my room for free.

First, Jeffrey, at the front desk is amazing. He remembered my favorite room and asked if I could wait about 15 minutes for it to be pre-paired. Sure, I'll go to the bar and the bartender was very friendly and we chatted about jazz. Jeffrey came by with a card for a free drink and true to his word, my room was ready.I love this room because it has a view of the Lincoln Center Plaza, fountains and all. The room is across the street from many restaurants and of course LC.The bellman has, in the past, retrieved items that I had left in the room and always greets me with a smile.

Hundred meters from Central Park SouthA little bit more than 1km from Times SquareSwimming pool closed during our stay (winter period)Breakfast very good but a little bit expensivePerfect welcome by the personnelPerfect property

We were in town for a wedding. The staff was wonderful, our housekeeping did a fabulous job. I was very happy with everything and plan on coming back! We had so much fun. The food in the rooftop was delicious. A little pricey though. But it was very good. The hotel bar made the drinks perfectly. It was a wonderful experience and I look forward to coming back soon.

Wonderful hotel - standard queen room is quite small, but that's par for NYC. Comfortable bed, amenities, very nice and courteous staff. Being in same hotel as the beautiful rooftop lounge/restaurant was a bonus.

This hotel is in a great location, very convenient to get to many places in the city. The lobby is beautiful! The room was a good size, had a jr. suite with two beds and a sitting area. The furnishings were a bit worn and some things broken, the bathroom wasn't very clean (especially the bathroom door which is a frosted glass that was filthy). The front desk staff was less than friendly and not very welcoming, just seemed bothered at any interaction. Not sure that I would stay again, with a little effort on customer service, cleanliness and updates to room furnishings.

If you are traveling to New York to attend concerts at Lincoln Center, the location of the Empire is unbeatable. Staff is friendly and accommodating. Rooms are a little small, but not unexpected for New York. Overall a great value.

In my opinion , one of the BEST hotels in the City. Location is perfect, entire staff is perfect, room is very comfortable! I LOVE this hotel - always consistent with service, value, and welcoming feeling.

Excellent view of Lincoln square, great location, (we walked to everything, in the rain-just take a taxi), great restaurants across the street, (Fiorello and Smith), excellent service and friendly staff; clean, comfy room!!!!! We had a blast!

If you are going to the Met, the Empire Hotel is across the street from Lincoln Center. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are small, but clean and comfortable. There are a variety of good restaurants close by.

The Empire Hotel's rooms are comfortable and nicely furnished, despite the fact that the building is old. They have done a wonderful job of modernizing the lobby with a great bar and the restaurant/lounge on the rooftop offers a great view of the city. The bathrooms are a little small but you have everything you need and the shower is wonderful! The staff is very accommodating and I was checked in by Jeffrey, who is polite, friendly, very helpful and remembered me from prior visits. I was in room 1016 with a great view of Lincoln Center, one of my favorite parts of the city.

It was pleasant stay in this hotel. The room was clean but there is no bathroom fan, which is strange. You have to open the bathroom door to be the steam out. Otherwise, it’s good hotel. Liked the bottle water service a lot.

Perfect location near Columbus Circle. Close to many restaurants. Has a bar on site. Parking is off site about 2 min walk away. Clean, good bathroom. Bed was very uncomfortable. Honestly will likely stay here again.Only issue was I couldn't get in touch with front desk before the trip and I called about 8 separate occasions.

First time travelling to America and it was the most incredible experience. We were amazed at how we were looked after by the native Americans. The city itself was astonishing, so fast paced but you can fit in very easily.

I had a meeting at the ABC building in NYC and chose this hotel based on reviews and proximity. Location was great - right next to the Lincoln Center and quick walk to restaurants and the ABC building. Check-in was smooth. I was given a room on the 11th floor (their top floor). Upon walking into the room, I noticed it was hot and stuffy. The thermostat wasn't working so I called down to the front desk. They sent up an engineer, who wasn't able to fix the problem. He let the front desk know I wanted to change rooms. Luis from the front desk called me right away, was super nice, asked if I needed any help with my luggage, and asked me to come down to get a new room assignment. He explained that the 11th floor does get a little warm. He was about to assign me a room on a lower level, but when I mentioned the great view from the 11th floor he had another idea. He actually upgraded me to an amazing room on the 11th floor. The new room was amazing - living room, 2 bathrooms, bar, etc... Truthfully, it was still a little warm, but not nearly as warm as the first room. Unfortunately, I am a light sleeper and there was a lot of noise coming from above (the rooftop bar??) so I didn't get a great night's sleep. But that's not really the hotel's fault. In the end, I would recommend this hotel. However, if you like your room on the cooler side, I would request a lower floor. And again, special shout-out to Luis, who went out of his way to make sure I had a good experience.

I checked in and got a upgrade ,deff a plus. Front desk staff was very helpful always had answers for my questions and needs. Rohan stood out to me always having food options and solutions, my room was not serviced for a day and I did not leave the DND sign on door but Rohan ensured I got fresh towels and toiletry replacement. Bell staff Denise was amazing friendly and welcoming also. Would stay again.

A very well located hotel, clean, with friendly helpful staff. It's starting to show its age in places and a refurb would be welcome. However, it is clean and housekeeping good. A great location just off Columbus Circle and the No1 subway line. We would stay again.

Such a lovely hotel with very helpful and initiative staff. We had booked a triple room for 3 adults but the first room we was in wasn't even big enough for 1 there was no room to put clothes a tiny hole to put a few clothes also no where to put any suitcases... especially because all three of us had taken large suitcases with us as we were due to stay in the hotel for a week. So originally we were very disappointed with the room because it was lacking in space for general living space! Also being three adults we were happy with two double beds but when we entered the room we then realised that the double beds are small double beds... which we were not aware of as the website does not specify, so if you are planning on sharing a bed in a triple room DONT, as the beds were basically a large single! As we were unhappy with our room due to the lack of space we headed down to reception just to ask if they had any other rooms available that were bigger as we didn't have anywhere to put anything let alone being able to even open our suitcases in the room. The receptionist Louis was very helpful and kind, he managed to transfer us to a bigger room as he explained that we were there for my daughters 21st and he wanted to make it as special as possible for us, he also did not charge us for the upgrade do to agreeing that our particular room could not fit 3 adults in comfortably. Our new room we were transferred to was a lot more spacious and actually had a walk in wardrobe to put our clothes in and to store our suitcases in! So that we didn't have to leave them on the floor and potentially trip over them! This is the type of room you should stay in if there is more than 2 of you or you actually want space to put your items, the only thing about the bigger room was that the beds were yet again a 'small double'/'large single' which is not ideal if you have to share... apparently all those rooms had the same size beds which isn't great especially as there is room to put a larger bed. But apart from the room drama the hotel was amazing the staff are very helpful and friendly! From letting them use the reception phone to call out or giving you directions round NY or hailing you a cab they were just great! If you stay at The Empire Hotel you need to check out the rooftop bar and restaurant the breakfast is great and the views up there are just amazing, you could sit up there all day just watching New York fly by!!! Overall The Empire Hotel was great and would recommend

It takes more than location, nice beds and a reasonable price to make a great hotel. It takes a friendly, helpful and knowledgeable staff. The Empire has it all !!At the front door you are greeted by Eugene, Brian, Denis, Chris, Denise, Naz, Jose, Brendan (Depending on the hour and the day). At the front desk Maggie relieves any concern that this will be a wonderful stay. She is warm, experienced and even if she is overwhelmed with customers she makes you feel that you are the only one. guest.

On arrival we were early so rooms were not ready, however they offered to upgrade our room for free if we wanted to have separate rooms rather than interlocking which was fine as these were ready. Room was OK but needed a bit of updating, especially the bathroom. The main issues were the noise from the road outside and the cold due to poor windows. We had to have the heating on most of the time which made just as much noise as the beeping horns and sirens. We were on the fourth floor. However room was clean and comfortable beds and the staff were polite and helpful.Hotel was in a great location, 5 minutes from central park and 20 minute walk to times square. Beware of the residence tax before booking as this is an extra £25 per room/night. This had been included in our holiday booking but basically for us this paid for 2 small bottles of water a day. Ensure to check their website for details of this.

We arrived late to our room after a night out. I have stayed here numerous times so this last visit was a surprise how dirty our room was. I didn’t notice until the next morning when I was in the bathroom. The bathroom door was grimy with finger prints all over it an some kind of spillage on the bottom of the door, the cabinets didn’t look like they had ever been wiped down,but the truly disgusting thing was the toilet seat lid. RealIy really grimy! I sent a letter to the hotel manager, and to her credit, she called our room right aware and assured me everything would be taken care of right away. When we returned to our room there was a hand written note with an apology and some treats. But the room was still dirty.the bottom of the door had been cleaned. Dirty fingerprints still on the door and toilet seat still disgusting. That will be my last stay there ever.

The location of the hotel is perfect. It's close to shops and restaurants, a few blocks from subway station and a pleasant walk from Times Square. Hotel lobby is charming and check-in was quick and easy. Rooms are safe and clean, however too small and dated.The main problem during our stay were low outside temperatures that weren't compensated by proper heating. The air-conditioning was actualling cooling our room which meant I has to sleep in jumper and socks to stay warm.

Great location. Close to subway lines. Staff was extremely helpful. We arrived early and we were able to check in and even got a room upgrade. Rooftop lounge has great drinks and views of the city. Would stay again

A renovated older property with friendly management, large rooms for NYC, many nearby restaurants -- and Lincoln Center across the street. Comfortable, not luxurious. Close to subways, Central Park, museums. Rosa Mexicano, around the corner, is an outstanding Mexican restaurant. Many more on 9th Ave.

Lovely big rooms with comfortable beds, slightly noisy from the corridors however. Staff were very friendly though, certainly felt at home here. The rooftop bar was beautiful, but unfortunately we weren’t able to access the terrace the two times we tried due to private events. Overall I had a great time at the hotel and will definitely stay here again!

decent size room and a good location. The bathroom was very small but the shower worked well; bed was comfortable; staff offered waters to couple next to us checking in but not us-- I had to ask for water. I did not like that first impression.

this was a good choice for one night. It was close to were i needed to go. The hotel was clean and everyone was friendly. Restaurants and Bakery are nearby as well as Lincoln Center. My only complaint is no in room coffee maker and no USB ports.

I have stayed at hotels across the world and this is the first time I have ever had a room that doesn't offer top sheets on the bed unless requested. Not informed of this when I checked in. Absurd and a cheap way to save a few bucks. First and last time in this property.

We recently stayed in The Empire Hotel on a 4 night stay in New York. I was a bit dubious after reading mixed reviews but I can honestly say I can’t fault the hotel. From the helpful lobby staff to the room service, we had an amazing stay. The rooms are generous in size and the beds are amazingly comfy - perfect after a full day of site seeing. The location is perfect, situated only a 1 minute walk from Central Park and you can easily walk into Timesquare in about 15 mins or jump on the underground. As some other reviews state, it can be quite noisy at times with the traffic but where isn’t in New York! The noise didn’t stop us from sleeping or enjoying our stay. Ignore the poor reviews, we loved it and would definitely be recommending to friends and family planning their trips to New York! Thank you for a fabulous stay.

The Empire Hotel is beautiful hotel. The designer boutique style hotel is located in the heart of Lincoln Center. If you like classical music, ballet, opera and art cinema-Lincoln Center is the place for you and your family. Just a short walk over to Central Park and some great restaurants in the area. If you are a light sleeper I don’t recommend this hotel.The windows in the hotel are outdated and you can hear everything outside.

Nice overall. We were in a very small room when told it was a deluxe superior. I think they messed up because when we extended a third night, our room we were moved to was much bigger, similar price. They are not the most kid friendly. Overall we had a great visit with family. Very close to Central Park and great site seeing!

Nice hotel, good location. Small room. No coffee in room. High priced. No frills. Nothing to really write home about. I would not stay here again. Basic, basic, basic...too much money for nothing special.

Perfect spot, excellent service, clean and comfortable room. I highly recommend this hotel for a weekend. The staff is very friendly, especially the receptionists. Close to many metro/bus stations. Thanks!

Great hotel in a lovely and convenient location—one block from Central Park, on train line, long but doable walk to Broadway shows, and right next to opera and symphony. Room was clean and quiet. No view but we only slept and showered there. Will definitely stay again.

Our room had the most amazing view and the staff was always so kind and helpful. The location was perfect and the hotel was so easy to spot from far away! We will most definitely be back to Empire Hotel.

First room was 85 degrees. Maintenance came in at 3am to fix it and said they couldn't. Second night we were moved to another room. Loud loud loud clicking noises all night! We called the front desk and told them and they were like "yeah this is just an old building it makes loud noises at night" THANKS FOR NOTHING

The hotel is located in a good spot in New York. Really easy to go everywhere. It close to Central Park and subway. There are a bar in the hotel near the front deck and Starbucks next to the hotel. Classy decoration and nice staff!

I always love staying at the Empire but the hotel rooms are tired. Bathrooms are super small and I dislike a shower curtain. Other than that, I still love staying there bc the people are so nice and the location is wonderful.

Small but cozy place in Upper West Side. I was there for Westminster so it was conveniently located and the online price was pretty good. I went in with pretty low expectations as I had never stayed there. I was please to be greeted (and helped throughout the stay) by very friendly door staff and very accommodating desk staff. The lobby was very warm and relaxing. Almost a throwback to another time. I ended up with a king room with a view of a small park and Lincoln Center. Although it was on the "first floor" (not lobby level) I noticed very little outside noise. The carpet and wall paprer were kind of interesting choices but very boutique hotel type. I thought it was different but cool. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable but low to the ground, as were the chair and desk. The room was small but I think that's a NYC thing, although it was bigger than the Doubletree that I also stayed in. The bathroom was extremely small but clean and efficient use of the little space It did the job. They have a super cool roof level bar. Definitely not a place for a cheap drink but apparently very popular. Over all a great stay.

Door man was friendly and helpful as was all staff. The lobby is welcoming and contemporary and a great place to hangout. The room was clean and inviting with a small desk for work and a very comfy bed. My room faced the main street and it did get a bit noisy late at night and early in the morning - primarily taxi/traffic noises and horns blowing. Additionally, the room needed a couple more easily asseible outlets for plugging in electonic devices.

Excellent hotel! We have stayed here many times. The staff was very accommodating to our needs and we love the trendy decor. Super cool vibe!!! We also think the area is the best place to stay in the whole city. We will be back!!!

We booked this hotel for its proximity to Lincoln Center, and it did have that in its favor, but that was the only thing. The heating unit in our first room was so noisy that we could hardly hear ourselves. We went to the front desk and had to persuade the person there to give us another room. In that one, the heating unit made a clanking noise that kept up awake at night. We also asked the front desk person where to buy a bottle of wine and were sent on a wild goose chase down Columbus Ave.

I booked my room and paid in full online, all fees included according to the contract, but was charged an additional resort fee. When I inquired about the additional charge, the manager was rude and dismissive and offered no explanation. Also, hotel staff entered my room unexpectedly, without knocking, while I was in it . I had not called for any sort of room service.

Great place to stay. Wonderful location, close to many wonderful attractions, plus great service and reasonable price. Staff was helpful and friendly. Will stay there from now on whenever we go to NYC.

Location simply cannot be beat. Steps ( literally) from Lincoln center. Uptown, downtown, crosstown busses and subway within a block. And 6 restaurants, grocery, takeout, Duane Reade and Starbucks all right there. Why am I telling you this? All the rooms will probably be booked for my next visit!

Best hotel in NYC - great value, location, staff is second to none - all around great experience time after time!! Easy access to all the great experiences in the city, Lincoln Center, Fordham University, the restaurants are fabulous and easy to get to, let alone the access to Broadway. Again - I will always stay at the Empire!

Love this hotel, very clean and comfortable. The rooftop bar and views are great. I love the location as it’s near Fordham University. Excellent restaurants near here. Hotel staff make you feel welcome. Bathrooms can be small but that is expected in New York City.

I was in New York on business and the closest hotel to the venue at which I was working was The Empire. The place is nice and my checkin went smoothly. I slept pretty well. I woke up and went to the gym located within the hotel. Half the weights were missing and the treadmill kept getting stuck. This may seem inconsequential for most however I travel quite a bit for work and book conditionally on the fact that there is a gym on the premises so I can maintain a modicum of normalcy while traveling. So when the equipment was not so great, I was a bit displeased. However I kept up my optimism because I figured it wasn't all bad. Then I got to my room, and decided it was time for a good old fashioned shower. That idea quickly fell flat because the shower head was busted. It did dispense some water, but however it was remarkably slow. I packed my things quickly and made my way out of the hotel.

Overall my stay at Empire Hotel was excellent. The staff was great and the rooms were wonderful! The hotel is located in a great location. It was very easy getting to our destinations. The staff exceeded my expectations.

The Empire Hotel is in an excellent location to walk to all sorts of venues and restaurants. It is right across the street from Lincoln Center. When we arrived, our room reservation had a problem due to a booking company's error, but Pasquale not only took care of the mistake but gave us an upgrade to a corner room with views of Lincoln Center and streets leading uptown. We walked to our evening comedy show and to a fabulous restaurant, again just a couple blocks from the hotel. We will definitely stay at this hotel again.

On the upper west side overlooking Lincoln Center. One block from Central Park. Near lots of restaurants and subways. Very clean and efficient. More like a European hotel. Small bathroom. We got a great deal. Nice rooftop lounge and nice lobby bar. Starbucks on the corner. Great place for visiting NYC.

Uncomfortable bedFitness room needs to be updated drastically. It was atrocious. Outdated equipment!Utilize the space on the roof top with such a glamorous view. It would be perfect for a fitness center!

The staff was, for the most part, friendly and helpful. Lovely rooftop breakfast. Location is awesome - right across the street from Lincoln Center. Very handy for arrival and departure via LaGuardia. I recommend the bigger rooms.

I stay often at the Empire when I travel for business. The staff is excellent. The room comfortable and the neighborhood is wonderful. I stay there weekly and it is like being at home. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

This was a great find. We have stayed all over NYC and always appreciate a big beautiful room, great shower, beautiful lobby/bar and of course the amazing roof top bar. Lincoln Center views ;))The staff was very friendly as this was a last minute decision. Downstairs there was one of our fav restaurants, PJ Clark’s and we got take out from The Smith across the street. Highly recommend The Empire Hotel !

Positives - great shower! There’s nothing worse than a bad shower in a hotel, it’s not the case here!Great location, Comfortable bed, pleasant view, friendly and helpful staff.Negatives - front of hotel has scaffolding, walls of rooms are not sound proofed, you can hear too much from the room next door. Some tired looking details need updating.I’ll mention this on every post...I booked through my Chase Reserve and always get a room next to the elevator! Why?Overall a good experience, great location and would consider again.

Nice hotel right across the street from Lincoln Center. Excellent restaurants nearby and easy access to the subway. Very friendly and helpful staff. You can also park overnight right under Lincoln Center. Room was spacious for NYC and the bed was very comfortable. Powerful shower also! Only issue was that the heat was a bit challenging to adjust. Overall, it was a great place to stay.

Pros:Excellent location, excellent service, excellent valet, excellent housekeeping, excellent engineering, excellent hotel lobby bar and rooftop lounge, rooms facing courtyard very quiet despite no viewCons:none of the handicapped rooms have comfortable beds - avoid if possible, be mindful of step-up to shower stall in regular rooms, towels need fabric softener

Yes, the rooms are small, but it's New York. And what are you doing in your room anyway, besides sleeping and using the restroom? There is no coffee maker in the standard room, but we discovered that if you call the front desk, they'll bring up an electric tea kettle, cups, and tea. We loved the location, as it was close to where we needed to be. This was our second time there, and we will definitely stay again!

Great experience during our 4 day stay at the Empire for my wife's birthday. Friendly, helpful staff with modern amenities. Restaurant and bar were both well maintained. Slow WiFi however a small issue in the overall stay.

I am a long time customer. The room I got needs an upgrade although it has a great view. The bed was uncomfortable and felt old and the carpet needs to changed and upgraded. I was too tired to request a change and it was late. Needs refreshing and an upgrade. Too dark.The staff at the front desk are great.

review_body: The bed was comfortable and room was nice. However, there is the need to improve many things. 1- TV was badly placed. If two people were in the room, the person on the left side of the bed would not be able to properly see the TV. Specially, with the curtains open. 2- Air conditioning was very loud. No matter which level it was, the air was just making too much noise. 3- Toilet seat was not attached to the floor. When you sit, the seat will tilt and make noise.4- Windows were not very sound proof and I was on the 10th floor.5- The dresser's top drawer did not close. You close it and it would very slowly reopen and stay like that.On the good side, the bed was very good. The personal health products were also good and many. Towels and sheets were good and except for the points above, all was fine.

It is nice to know that there are still places in Manhattan that make you feel safe and at home (away from home). The location is super. Right next to Lincoln Center, Equinox and a long list of entertainment, Including transportation. Highly recommended! A shout out to Frank the bartender and Jeffery at the front desk!

Great value for a fantastic location right next to Lincoln Center. Beds are perfect and rooms are neat and unique. The staff is friendly and very helpful. Surrounded by great restaurants and walking distance from many more.

This was the third I have stayed at the Empire Hotel. The location is ideal and the rooms are comfortable and excellent value for the price. The staff is also very friendly and helpful. I will definitely return to the Empire on my next visit to New York. Highly recommended!,

This is our go to when we need a night away. Convenient, clean and a good breakfast. Wish there was a mini bar in the room and room service. Overall, it’s worth it during off peak days. We’ll definitely return.

review_body: We have stayed at the Empire hotel a few times and have always enjoyed our time. This time was was no different, however we interacted with the staff a bit more. Daniel was wonderful at the front desks when we asked to change our room to a larger option as there were 4 of us. We upgraded for a very reasonable cost to a corner suite. Very roomy and totally comfortable. Leilani one of the managers, checked in that all was good with our room. All staff was kind, pleasant to deal with and made us feel like we were home. We are New Yorkers and live out of state now so anytime we can feel like we’re back at home in the city, we are very happy! Thank you Leilani, Daniel and the entire staff at “The Empire” we will see you soon again !

Visited here with family over three rooms. All staff were courteous friendly and helpful if needed. Rooftop bar only visited once but was lovely area. Location is good away from hustle and bustle of other areas of nyc and near good restaurants for breakfast and dinner if needed. Our room that we were sharing was particularly small and dark , nowhere to store cases and one very small high rail for clothes that could not reach. The bathroom is in major need of a refurb as is showing lot of wear and tear. Overall a clean hotel, lovely staff and great location .

This is a great hotel! We love the location and the rooftop restaurant/bar! It’s clean and comfortable with a great staff! The lobby is super cool-looking too. We love the proximity to some great restaurants and attractions and will definitely stay here again!

We had a terrific experience at The Empire Hotel while visiting NY with our two children. The room was well appointed and had everything we needed for our stay. We appreciated the price point and the excellent service we had from everyone we interacted with. Be sure to visit the rooftop bar at sunset and then cap off the night at the lobby bar! You cannot beat this location for easy access to the Subway line to the Battery, theater district, and museums. Walk across the street to Lincoln Center and have great food at nearby restaurants and bakeries.

This is a very well run and staffed hotel in a perfect location. My room was ample, pristine, and modestly priced. I can't say enough about the helpfulness of the staff, from the doormen to the desk to housekeeping. Many thanks.
user_name:
EDBdc
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Clean, spacious rooms, very friendly staff and great location in the city. From the valet, to guest check in, to the housekeeping staff, all extremely very polite, helpful and beyond friendly. I highly recommend this property!

Me and my girlfriend visited in January and it was absolutely brilliant. The staff are brilliant, especially the front desk staff and doorman. Hotel rooms were very tidy and could not find a single thing to complain about. Already looking to book our next trip! Location is extremely exceptional!

We had a great stay as we were in town for the opera and the ballet. The hotel is steps from Lincoln Center. Great restaurants and Starbucks are nearby. Central Park is a short walk. We will definitely be back.

I booked this place specifically to be near the Lincoln Center as we had tickets to the opera and were going to be in formal wear. It's excellent for being right across the street.The lobby was beautiful, the front desk was very efficient checking us in and the room was nicely appointed and clean. The front door staff (bell hop) were very friendly and helpful getting us both unloaded and loaded coming and going.Yes, the room was typical New York small but for the price and location, I thought it was a great deal. The rooftop bar was pretty cool but too loud at night so we decided on going to the lobby bar instead. Good service and nice craft cocktails.As mentioned in other reviews, there was no ice machine so we had to request from the front desk but no big deal and it was delivered timely.To get anywhere by subway, the 66th Street Lincoln Center station was pretty close but a short walk to the 59th Street Columbus Circle station eliminated having to transfer sometimes.

Convenient to Lincoln Center, good restaurants & subway. Worth the price to us to be able to walk to Lincoln Center. All rooms are noisy (it is New York, after all). Rooms on the inside are quieter than on the outside.

This hotel was a great location. We enjoyed the short walk to Central Park and shopping. The rooms are rather small so we got a king suite which was great. The staff was helpful and friendly. The hotel was clean and quiet.

Ideal location to get around NYC with access to the subway taxis or walk to without being in the full on hustle and bustle of being nearer to times square. Highly recommend. Will be going back and possibly stay here again

Visited here late January... hotel reception it lovely, staff are very friendly, which is a big shock as everyone in NY are rude! But every staff member we spoken to was so nice! 5 minute walk from central park, 15 minute walk to time square! So great location, they also have a roof top bar which was very nice but expensive, HOWEVER the rooms are VERY POOR! , so small no where to store any clothes, dated heating system blows out cold air for 5 minutes and then blows out cold, bathrooms are tiny and not very clean, although the shower is very powerful that was probably the only good thing about the room, and also the hall ways are very dated, i feel like all the money they have they have put into the lobby and roof top, looks like two completely different hotels Wouldnt stay here again!

This hotel is in a great location and the staff is very helpful. I was, however, unprepared for how ugly the room was! Perhaps they have better rooms but mine was on a lower floor and it was very dark. The furniture was quite tasteless. There was only one lamp in the room (by the bed) so if you wanted to work at the desk you couldn't. There was a large TV but no remote control! I am glad I didn't pay too much for this room. It was so depressing that I decided to brave the snow storm on my check-out day rather than spending one more night in that room.You may want to hire their photographer, though. They did a great job with the photos of the rooms!

We stayed here for a night after an opera at Lincoln Center. This hotel was quiet and clean and decorated quite nicely. There is a lovely lobby that you can wait or relax in (also a lobby bar). We got a slightly early check-in with no problem. The staff was attentive and efficient. This hotel is very close to many good dining options at several price points. We enjoyed our short stay and are definitely putting the Empire Hotel on our list of good NYC hotel options. (One caveat: no in-room coffee, but there is a coffeeshop--Starbucks--around the corner)

Well my girlfriend and I decided to stay at the empire hotel in Manhattan but before we decided to stay she showed me pictures of the hotel and it looked amazing the colors were bright and beautiful i told her i didnt want to stay at a place where the colors were dark and dull so the empire was definitely not that from the pictures that I saw and it looked updated and the rooms looked modern and well kept so before we got to the hotel my girlfriend called to ask if we can check in early our check in time wasn't until 3pm they said that they couldn't tell us over the phone we would have to go to the hotel so we drove from Jersey to Manhattan only to find out that we have to wait for an hour and half to check in so we sat around because we had no where to go and nodded off because we both were tired from working the night before so I went back to the concierge to ask her can we check in now she said the room that we ask for isnt ready yet but they have a room on the 2nd floor at the time I was like I dont care I just want to rest my head because I was exhausted so we took the room on the 2nd floor and the first thing I noticed was the bathroom it wasnt what the pictures showed and then how small the rooms were and how dark the light were in the hallway was disappointed.and because we were in Manhattan you can hear the honking of the taxi horns through the windows and that made matters worse because we were so exhausted. I dont mind spending alittle more if the hotel is modern and if they make an effort to try and help there customer and I wish the concierge lady tried to help I dont think I'll be staying there again.

Great location for shopping, restaurants, food, and Lincoln Center. The Empire Hotel is our standard hotel for NYC visits because of the proximity to our business locations, Lincoln Center, prefered restaurants and shopping

Usually in previous stays in the Empire, I have been pleased with the room and never experienced such a disaster as a heater that would not turn off. I felt like I was at a stifling summer camp. This room and other rooms on the same floor that were west facing all had issues with overheating. Windows were inoperable. I have in the past praised this hotel, but watch out for a miserable room assignment.I will go back because of the proximity to the Met Opera and the opportunities offered for entertainment at Lincoln Center. Next time, I'll be on guard against a raunchy room assignment, as you should be!.

I often travel to NYC from Belgium for seminars. Of all the places I have stayed at I like the Empire Hotel the best... kudos to the friendly and helpful staff, rooms are clean and location is great, right next to the iconic Juilliard school!

Had an excellent time staying at The Empire Hotel. Cleanliness, support, & ammenities were just as I needed. Price was very reasonable and location was convenient. Will definitely be looking into staying here again next time.

We have just returned from visiting NYC and stayed at this lovely hotel. Although the rooms are quite small there is enough space for what you need when visiting this very busy city. The rooms were clean and tidy and you could not hear the noise from the nearby Times Square. The hotel is perfectly situated away from the madness but close enough to walk to Central Park and Times Square. We did not eat at the hotel as our schedule was so busy but would definitely stay here again.. we want to visit again soon!

I took my wife to Lincoln Center for her birthday and even though we live nearby in the suburbs we decided to stay for the night at the Empire. The hotel is PERFECT for this purpose. I was very thankful that Jeffrey made check-in a breeze and accommodated a very special request for ust. We had dinner at Rosa Mexicano around the corner, then a great time at La Traviata and finally spent a couple of hours in the beautiful and chic rooftop lounge.HIGHLY recommended for comfort, convenience and fun! We will be back!

review_body: It was terrible air control quality. There is no water given and you’re charged for extra toilet paper. Room smelt of mold and was the size of a shoe closet. $150 refundable deposit on room in case of any damages when everything in the room is worth less than stuff you’d find in a dollar store.

Stay away at all costs Valet broke my windshield, hotel gave me their number. Can only speak to a “manager” who apparently only works a couple of days a week. The guys there just hang up on you. Hotel manager doesn’t return phone calls. Stay far away from this horrible establishment.

New York City, New York

review_body: We had a wonderful stay at the Empire. I would highly recommend staying here. Can’t wait to come back. The location of the hotel to points in walking distance is great. There’s even a Starbucks on the corner.

Great location in a lovely area, very close to Central Park, metro and opera house. Staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms kept very clean by housekeeping staff. Everywhere in walking distance, doormen really friendly and great characters indeed.

This is a moderately priced hotel with an elegant lobby and comfortable, nicely decorated rooms. It's prime feature is its location - immediately across the street from Lincoln Center and right on Broadway with the subway nearby and buses across the street a 5-10 minute ride to Times Square The Upper West Side is lovely.

Stayed here from christmas day until 29th december. Check in was fast and pleasant the man on the desk (who's name I cannot remember) was extremely polite and helpful. We were in room 231 on the 2nd floor. The room was extremely warm. But I figured out within around 2 minutes yow to adjust the heater. We slept with the window open and did not suffer with any noise trouble at all. The beds were extremely comfortable. However. Many of the furniture items are old and tired and could do with replacing. The bathroom is tiny but does its job. The lobby is amazing and every gossip girl fans dream. The hotel is in an amazing location. 2 mins from central park. 2 mins from subway station. We had an amazing time and I would 100% return. Thank you

We’ve been to this hotel three times over the last 4 years, from Ireland.The staff are great and the location is perfect for exploring NYC.Central Park is a stone’s throw away. The shops at Columbus Circle are great for high end shopping, head the other direction and you have Centry12 and Bloomingdales Outlet.Great food around with the local restaurants, and a short walk to both Hells Kitchen and Harlem.We will be back!

Had a great stay here over Christmas, room and bed comfortable, staff helpful, friendly and courteous, some excellent restaurants close to the hotel. Spent an evening at the bar great service and cocktails, also had breakfast at the rooftop good service and food and great photos under the Empire Hotel neon.

This hotel stay was a gift from our daughter and we couldn't be more impressed the locadtion was great and close to the things we wanted to see. The building and rooms were beautiful and the staff was helpful and friendly. Who could ask for more?

Great location, nice lobby, very nice rooftop views. Safe and clean. In an upscale area with great entertainment and eateries. Comparable hotels in the area have heavy price tage, so nice price for the area. Recommended ,

Last minute decision to spend the night in the city. Had matinee tickets for Lincoln Center and brunch at P.J.Clarke's. Booked a room at this hotel as it is across the street from Lincoln Center. They were able to provide a room earlier then normal check in and the desk staff were wonderful. Had a conversation with the gentleman and he upgraded my room. The service was great and the roof bar, even in January(indoors) was a comfortable place for lunch. A true find.

a very good to stay for a pleasant travelvery good location near central park and colombus circleroom are very clean and beds very confortableThe bar and lobby are very nice, the roof top was closed, dommageI recommand this place for eveyboby

Location of the Hotel was great, Concierge was super friendly and helpful. Rooms are small, no real viewpoints from windows just looking at other near building windows. Room was OK, Comfortable Beds, No light in the Closet / Fridge / Safe Area too dark. TV could use an update. Carpet has wear and tear in some areas. Room could have been cleaned a bit better before we arrived, was fixed by the next day. Promised Daily Water never arrived. The room has some items that need to be fixed, Heater and Shower Fixture.But for the price we receviced, comfortable beds, location and staff I would stay again.

Love this Hotel, the Location is very central. Beautifully Furnished Lobby and Rooms. Very friendly staff very helpful. Would definitely recommend it to my best friends and family. Kind regards Aleksandra

I dont understand how they even sell such kind of rooms. Horrible noise. The worst 500 usd i spent for two nights. Tried to change rooms, the registration person said that what my rate gives. Make your own decision on this

Great hotel. Convenient to where we need to go. Personnel was very helpful. Clean and great shower in our room. Breakfast was a let down as it was overpriced and not very good. Room was clean and noise was a minimum but we had ear plugs

Compared to other hotels in the area the staff stands out as the most friendly! Besides, this hotel is just steps from the Lincoln Center. There is NO other hotel that is that close. And this is important when season-ticket holders like us just walk to the Fiorello or Lincoln restaurants and then to the Center.

The room was adequate, had a bed and bathroom. Late on clean-up each day. NO ICE MACHINE,had to take Ice bucket and find some one at desk to fill it.Elevator to outside bar area not always operating. We were attending a graduation at the Lincoln center which was close by. Would not put this at the top of my do overe list.

No tea and coffee making facilities in rooms despite what website says or mini bar but get 2 very small complimentary water bottles each morning.Billed as mid range 3 star hotel but carpets hard and well worn,,low lighting masks some very tired decor posing as "boutique "...in the U.K. This would definitely not pass as a boutique hotel.Booked in Feb 2019 for new year 2020 asking for them high floor room and a bottle in the room for partners birthday,got neither,told that hotel was too full.Got 4th floor with a view of the back of the other rooms and a very noisy air con outside that NEVER goes off so take earplugs.Roof top bar great place to relax but this is NOT part of hotel so no special discounts or treatment. Nice views of the Lincoln centre and broadway.Good location but be aware if youve never been ,food is very expensive and you have to add tax to everything pls tips.PJ Clarkes bar/restaurant is nice right next to hotel.

Love the Empire! extremely friendly and helpful staff, GREAT location (near park, subway, etc), clean, spacious rooms for price. My only hesitation in writing this review is it spoils my little secret!

Lovely to spend a couple of days in this great city - right next to Lincoln Center! As soon as we got there, we headed up to the Rooftop to relax and enjoy a cocktail and watch the sun go down in the December sky. What a treat!

Very nice room and very friendly staff at this hotel. Good location with some shops nearby. We had a great time in New York for my wife’s birthday. We would definitely stay here again and we would definitely recommend

The Empire is close to several good restaurants including The Smiths which serves breakfast, lunch and dinner. Reservations needed. Shops are within walking distance as well as Fifth Avenue. Central Park is a short walk as well as Fordham University and Lincoln Center is across the street

From the very friendly and helpful check in staff and doorman to the quick responsiveness from housekeeping - this was a wonderful easy experience. Our room had a beautiful view of Lincoln Center and the overall positive vibe of the hotel was testament to the energy of the staff and beautiful setting.

Heat ran the entire time we were there even after it was supposedly fixed. The bar in the closet and hook on the bathroom door are impossible to reach unless you are 7 feet tall.Location for patrons of Lincoln Center is great.Several good restaurants nearby.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had a beautiful corner suite overlooking Lincoln Center. The staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the rooftop bar and there were several other eating options within a block.

I was get happy with my stay here. Great room. Clean, warm, comfortable. Right across from Lincoln Center. The check in staff were really nice. The lobby is gorgeous and there's a nice bar. Old New York elegance with modern touches.

Wonderfully situated in midtown, just a stones throw from central park and columbus circle. Wonderfully pleasant and accommodating staff. We felt we really got our money's worth on our booking for a five day stay over Christmas.

The location of The Empire hotel is perfect. With close links to the Subway, shopping in the Columbus Circle and a short walk away from Times Square and Central Park. The interior in the lobby and mezzanine area is beautiful.The Rooftop bar is another area with great interior and views. We tried the breakfast buffet In the rooftop bar on our last day and to say I was disappointed is an understatement. The breakfast available is not satisfactory for $28 per adult. Children are charged as an adult above the age of 10. $95 for a family of three for breakfast is a bit too pricey for the standard of food being offered. It really needs to be looked at as the breakfast available at the Rockefeller is the same price. Overall we had a great time in NYC but the disappointing breakfast has left a sour taste in my mouth!

Great value hotel, located on the upper west side. Walking distance to Central Park and Times Square. This served as a perfect place to set out and explore NYC. Rooms are clean, updated. Front desk service was wonderful. All needs were attended too with a smile.

We’ve stayed at the Empire a few times on trips to New York for Broadway and concerts. It’s got a great location and you can walk anywhere you want to go in about 15 minutes or just hop of the subway down the street. Rooms are cozy, showers are great (water pressure is nice), and staff are always friendly.Plus you get to stay on Sesame Street! Will stay here again.

Excellent hotel. We stayed from 24th December until the 29th of December and could not fault the hotel in any way.All of the staff were perfect in every way, courteous, pleasant, helpfull and very efficient.I struck up a great rapport with the two guys in the lobby bar so i will give them a special mention. two great guys....We would highly recomment the hotel to anyone who csres to visit New York.I do know we will be back......

Hotel was lovely and the staff were great upon check in and in the bar. The rooms were a little dated but after staying in nyc over 5 times this was one of the comfiest beds I have slept in. The housekeeping were lovely and couldn’t give us enough shower gel, shower caps etc. If I could change anything it would be the heat of the room. It was boiling and when we opened the windows it was really noisy from the air conditioning units. I would 100% stay here again but would maybe ask for a room on a higher floor away from the noise as if I was a light sleeper I would have been up all night. The hairdryer provided was a good one compared to other hotels and there is a small fridge to store drinks in etc. The cocktails in the hotel bar are lovely and the location is great. Columbus circle shopping centre, a subway stop, Duane Reade and a Starbucks just outside the hotel. What more could you want. We were also able to store our bags on the last day as our flight was later on we had an extra day exploring without having to worry about checking out.

review_body: Just arrived back from staying at this hotel and it was so lovely, rooms clean and tidy, beds so comfy, slept really well. Staff very friendly, polite and helpful. Walking distance to Time square, Central Park and Empire State, Would highly recommend this hotel, would definitely stay here again. Thank you

I have stayed at this hotel numerous times . My daughter goes to Fordham University. The empire is right across the street from Fordham. The staff is very helpful and attentive. And the view and food is delicious.

This was the filthiest room I have ever stayed in! The shower was so gross I didn’t even use it. I was so surprised that hotel of this type at Lincoln Square would have rooms like that. Unacceptable!!

New York City, New York

review_body: We travel to NYC twice yearly. Over the last couple of times, we have booked our stay at the Empire Hotel. It is near a subway stop, across the street from the Lincoln Center, lots of restaurant and shop all within easy walking distance - there is even a Starbucks around the corner! The hotel is a bit older, which makes it charming! How I rate the room are by the cleanliness of the room and bed comfort. The bed is very comfortable and clean. But one point I want to make it the level of service from the staff, especially the front desk staff. We booked the wrong date, on a busy weekend for NYC. The front desk staff got us a room, rate stayed the same, and quickly got the room ready! We plan to say there on upcoming trip in May 2020.

So we stayed in a Junior Suite for our trip to New York recently, which was booked for our first anniversary. On paper this is quite a premium New York City hotel. Just off Columbus circle, minutes from Central Park and a short walk or cab drive to broadway. I’m not sure if we were a bit unfortunate because we had a huge flight delay which meant we arrived at 4am, but the welcome was a bit underwhelming to say the least, especially for a city that doesn’t sleep apparently as there was no one to greet us at the door or help with luggage and the guy on the front desk wasn’t hugely welcoming either, I hardly got two words out of him.On getting to the room it was freezing, so we put the heater on which was the noisiest thing ever. I had messaged ahead to see if they had synthetic bedding which they say they do, but what they actually mean is they have synthetic pillows and a blanket, which is useless in December lets be honest.The next morning after very little sleep we went to try breakfast, which is served in the rooftop lounge. There was no signage anywhere to say that this could only be accessed from the hotel reception, and we got pretty lost in the hotel side trying to find it. I had asked in advance if they had gluten and dairy free options which they said was no problem, but when we got there the guy offered me omelette and chips at 9am, and they didn’t have gluten free bread or any specifically gluten free options which wasn’t what I was informed. We gave up on eating at the hotel and found somewhere else, which was actually much better and less expensive.I asked the guy at the desk if there was any chance of moving to a room with a less noisy heater and also if we could get a duvet, he was quite abrupt to be honest and said ‘look lady were fully booked, I’ll see if I can g set a guy to look at the heater but it will be later I get around to it.’ When we got back to the hotel they had sorted the noisy heater but still no duvet which I chased up with housekeeping and they were much more helpful.We had a room on the sixth floor. The room itself was ok, it could do with a lick of pint if I’m honest and some of the plug sockets were loose which wouldn’t happen in the UK because of our laws, but the size was good, the bed was comfy, and it was quite a decent view of Columbus Circle. The shower was good, but the bathroom would have benefitted from an extractor fan.We had another issue with the standard of service was when we were late for dinner, had got locked out of the room because our keys had stopped working and needed an umbrella. We went to reception to explain and he gave us a new key, but even though he had them available would not lend us an umbrella to stop us being any later through no fault of our own which ended up costing us an extra 40 dollars keeping an Uber waiting by the time we had waited in line for a new key and then had to go back to the room. This to me was pretty basic, they could have easily left a note on our room about the extra umbrella if they were so worried about it going missing.We managed to grab a drink in the hotel bar on the last evening and the service was much better here, as too was it on the rooftop bar in the evening when we went there afterwards and the waitress was very clued up on allergies and what was on the evening menu.Overall I’m told this is a good hotel experience for New York, but for me I found it quite a disappointing experience and I’m not sure I would stay there again.

Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights everything is good busy weekend because of the holidays but everyone is a professional whenever I ask something at the front desk they will give ot to us right away. Just sad I didn't get the chance to see the empire hotel sign

Room was extremely hot and right next to laundry staff did move us to another room on third night. Each night it reached 80 degrees with the windows open and 35 outside and it was too hot to sleep at all

Great location if you're in town for the Christmas events !! Close to everything without dealing with the hustle of time square Rockefeller center*. Bell staff and front desk was friendly and very welcoming, we had some early mornings and some late evenings, somehow we kept meeting Rohan at the front desk and he always greeted us with a smile and always had adventure options for us to check out. You get two fiji waters daily which is cool because not many hotels offer that anymore. Thumbs up Empire and thumbs up Rohan !!

This is very well situated near Central Park and 2 mins form the nearest Subway station. Very easy to get around and staff very friendly. Air-con can be a bit on the loud side however bedrooms are a good size for NY and beds very comfy.Bathroom really clean and nice with toiletries and hairdryer (good quality) provided as well as safe and coffee making facilities.Very handy Starbucks just on the corner for your morning coffee.

Super friendly and attentive staff. Clean room and bathroom. The location is great; few blocks from two subway stations, Central Park and Columbus Circle. The only downside is the shower pressure was not that good, and someday, water wasn't hot enough in the morning.

This hotel was awesome and Luis and Randall hooked us up fat with the deals and room! 10/10 would come back! It is near so many things and my fiancé and I had a great time!! Thank you, The Empire. Beautiful!

Rooms were aight. Not really luxury at all. Kind of reminded me of a Ramada Inn inside the rooms, but the building is very beautiful. Luis and Randall hooked us up fat and so those factors balance the mediocre rooms.

Stayed here with my husband and our two young children for a few nights last month. We were really impressed. The location is obviously brilliant, but the rooms and main areas are fab too. We slept well on comfortable beds with no noise from the busy street outside. I loved the lavender toiletries that were supplied, and the rooftop restaurant for breakfast was lovely - great view and delicious food and super service. The only things to be aware of is no room service (however we were given the go-ahead to get takeout delivered to us via Uber Eats which made up for this!) and no baby cribs - however we were able to arrange for a crib (and stroller) to be delivered to the hotel ahead of our stay from a baby equipment rental company, and the hotel staff helpfully accepted the delivery before we arrived and got us all set up which was really appreciated. We had such a good stay that we wouldn't consider anywhere else next time we visit NYC, we would automatically choose The Empire Hotel again.

Amazing location and friendly staff. Beautiful rooms, great views and wonderful roof top bar. Close to central park to walk around for a morning or afternoon stroll. Just blocks away from 5th avenue and Broadway.

Stayed here as part of our honeymoon visit to New York and felt compelled to write a review. The location of the hotel is fine and the rooftop bar and lobby area are good however would never stay here again. Our room and bathroom were tiny, our AC didn’t work and when a member of staff told us he would get it sorted, we were greeted to a knock at our door an hour later and another member of staff holding a tiny heater - no explanation given and he just walked off! We were also in a room that had what sounded like a generator running constantly and it was unbearably loud. We decided, at 12.00am on our first night in New York, that we couldn’t stay there as we knew it would likely ruin our entire trip so we arranged to go to another hotel that night. On checking out, the staff at the desk did not seem interested in discussing our issues or how they could best try and help which summed it all up. Really take no pleasure in writing this but the hotel seemingly has a lot of issues from our brief experience.

andyb19857
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: Our group of six friends loved this hotel, recommended by another friend. We were right across the street from Lincoln Center, 1 block from Central Park, and were surrounded by excellent and varied restaurants. We walked to Times Square, Rock Center and enjoyed the Christmas time decorations and festivities. If you want a quieter room, ask for one that opens into the interior of the hotel. A beautiful view of the street and Lincoln Center means you'll hear every wailing siren all night long, so keep that in mind when asking for your room. No coffee pots in the rooms, but Starbucks is 1 storefront away. There were little refrigerators in the room too, so we were able to keep a bit of food and beverage cold.

Hotel it not bad it about 15-20 mins walk from Times Square staff helpful and very kind. Rooms not very big for double room bathroom was very small we didn’t like it personally clean and tidy hotel. Not ideal if you want to be closer or in Time Square

Had another great visit at the Empire. Love the location, and the rooftop lounge. Special thank you and shout-out to Mike and Gerard at the Lobby bar. They made the weekend extra fun and my birthday special. You only turn 21 once. PJ Clarke's is great and having a Starbucks so close is handy. We did have to move the fridge in the room as I dropped something, and the carpet could use a bit of a cleaning back there - but overall we loved our second stay and will stay again. Thanks again,The Canadian girls

This hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly. They store your luggage before/after checkout so you don't have to lug it around the city . Right across from Lincoln Center and a block from Central Park. I would stay here again without hesitation.

Was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. Swanky vibe upon entry, great location, room was clean, posh, small. Only issue was the housekeeping was VERY excited to service the room even with the do not disturb on the door. Problem? I mean if that’s the worst that we experienced then I call it a win. Bed was super tough, though. It actually helped by back but my husband was in agony. Overall I totally recommend it. Out room overlooked the Lincoln center and it was pretty perfect for our stay.

Prime location, large and clean Jr. Suite, quiet room (10th floor). Spartan breakfest, no coffee machine or tea in the room, WiFi router next to the room was broken, poor to none AT&T cellular reception in the room. Took 3 days to fix WiFi after numerous complains to front desk and Housekeeping. Overall - OK but I will look for something better next time for $3,500 per 7 nights.

We choose this hotel for our first time in New York and all was perfect. The room was big enough and very clean. The breakfast was vary and taste! All people at the reception were very kind especially Pasquale and Merylin, that we thank so much! Thank you for all and we hope to see you again as soon as possible! Thanks!!!

The Empire Hotel is the BEST “Hidden Gem” in New York City! Luxury hotel at modest rates. Location is perfect for everything NYC! Best walking distance hotel for Met Opera, Lincoln Center, Columbus Circle, Central Park, Tavern on the Green, Carnegie Hall, and everything uptown or midtown Manhattan. Great views of Lincoln Center in a spacious room, larger than the typical NYC hotel room. Great lobby waiting area with complimentary luggage storage, and the least expensive area overnight parking rates in NYC. Thank you Empire Hotel!Sgt Daniel McCaughan

Very nice hotel for the price. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Its in a good location on the west side of Central Park. My only complaint was that there was no coffee pot in the room, but it was easy to go upstairs to the reastaurant and get. Would definitely stay here again

Worst experience I’ve had at a hotel. They lost our reservation from booking.com and when we finally checked in the room we got was very obviously the room that’s never been updated since this hotel opened. The bathroom door was molding and falling apart and the shower never actually got any hotter than lukewarm. The thermostat was ripped off the wall and when we turned on the heater manually it started spewing smoke, we notified the front desk who had maintenance come and say there was nothing they could do. Hotel staff was rude and very obviously would rather do anything but help you. You’re much better off staying anywhere else but here.

I had been in New York before and I didn't like the city. Found it very difficult to find food and drink. Turns out the problem was the location. This hotel was across the road from some really good restaurants and was close to the metro. Really enjoyed my stay this time. We had a lovely view from room the staff were fantastic. I really enjoyed my stay here and would stay again.

Great hotel great location friendly staff great roof top bar noisy air conditioning unit needs updating would not turn off was making strange noise Tommy door man was very friendly gave us great advice nice cafe across street for breakfast

For a 4-star hotel, the amenities are subpar: The provided refrigerators don't cool down below 50°F (I had a thermometer on my keychain), which management should make clear to guests. In fact, I had them send up a second after the first didn't cool down enough, but all are of the same model, which are only suitable to "chill" drinks and candy bars typically found in a mini bar. I had counted on the fridge to store breakfast items (e.g,. yogurt, cold cuts, etc.) as well as leftovers and basically all of them were of questionable safety after one night in the fridge. No coffee maker or hot water kettle were provided. The fitness room was left unkempt: no towels and no wipes on the two days I visited. Subpar lighting and insufficient outlets, especially near the bed. Doors slam loudly and revererabate, which threaten peaceful sleep for light sleepers like myself. That said, the location cannot be beat and the housekeeping was very good. Reception staff were helpful and efficient.

The sink didn’t drain, ac didn’t cool even in 40 degree weather. Lighting was horrible, couldn’t even find clothes in the suitcase with the lighting. The light over the shower was completely exposed, and a fire hazard. Every pillow we had was horrible. Housekeeping was amazing and always helpful.

I found a tick in my room. The manager refused to compensate me saying, "We'll have to investigate it first." This is after I handed here a plastic bag with a live tick in it. Earlier, when I told my colleagues I was staying at the Empire, my colleagues asked me if I had bug spray. So this is a well-known issue. I recommend you stay there if you like tick-borne diseases.
