review_body: Very happy with my recent stay at the Empire Hotel. Check in was easy and they graciously upgraded my room and allowed me to check in before the 3pm usual time. Very much appreciated. I plan to make this my regular business hotel in NYC and have already booked a room for next week. Hopefully the same room and staff!

Apon reading other people reviews i was orignally a bit worried about staying here but all these worries went straight away and had an absolutely amazing stay!!!! We arrived about 9pm on a Monday and was greeted by several memebers of lovely staff. Check in was quick and simple, we was told about how we get our 2 free bottles of water each day.Our room was on the 6th floor next to the liftt but not once could you hear any noise coming from it. Our room was perfect size for me and my partner and the bed was the most comfiest bed i have ever slept in and i wish i could take the mattress home with me. Although we kept our rook clean and tidy every day after a long day in the city we came back to find the room spotless and bathroom supplies topped up.On our lasy day we finished our day of early and went back to the hotel to sit in the lobby to wait for our transfer the hotel had no issue with this we also got a drink from the lobby bar while we waited. The hotel stored our suitcases for us for the day which again was another simple and quick process.The hotel is in a great location with lots of shops near by and a subway station with less then a minutes walk, central park a few minutes walk away and times square was about a 10 minute walkOverall i was gutted about leaving the hotel and will 100% stay here again on my next vist. amazing hotel ,lovely caring staff and great location what else do you need.

Every staff member I came into contact with was friendly, helpful & genuinely seemed to care if guests were having a good visit. They all deserve a raise (and, no, I don’t know anyone who works there). Consistently high customer service like that is rare. If you want a lot of nightlife in the immediate area, this might not be your spot. Same is true for restaurants—not as many as some other neighborhoods. If you want a well-located, relatively (for NYC) quiet area near Lincoln Center, subway line 1 and kinda close to Central Park, this may be for you.

We just happen to pick this hotel due to the location near Central Park. It ended up as a perfect choice near great restaurants & shopping and away for the craziness of the Time Square & Rockefeller Center during the Holiday Season, It was an easy walk to any of these venues.

We had a suite, so the room size was good, and location is ok, but based on the following issues, I would not recommend this hotel:- Heater - the first night one of our heaters was broken, so they came to fix it. However, the other heater made such a horribly loud noise that it kept us up all night, which with a 2 year old was a nightmare. We asked for it to be fixed, and they said that is just the way the old steam heaters work, so we ended up sleeping without heat the next 2 nights. It was better to be freezing that not sleep due to the horrid noise.- Check in - room was not ready until 30 min after check out time. Would not have been a huge deal, but in combination with everything else, it was just one more negative- Bathroom - Felt dingy, and there was a rusty wall/side of shower that I suppose was to make it look "industrial," but it stuck out oddly and you had to be extra careful not to stub your toe on the rusty area that jutted out- Room - Everything seemed a bit dingy and old. There was no trashcan and we had to request ice delivery, which came the first night, but never arrived the second night.

This is our second trip to NYC and we again find ourselves joyfully staying at the Empire Hotel, for one simple reason...it is at the cultural ground-zero of the Big Apple. It is the only hotel across the street from Lincoln Center (Met Opera, NYC Ballet), one block off the south end of Central Park, and within easy walking distance of literally everything you could want to see in New York. Not to mention that it is a beautiful property staffed by some wonderfully helpful people and you will find that you will not want to stay anywhere else...as we have!

Traveling with two couples and this hotelpleased us all. Especially grateful for an adapted room as I have back injury and knee issues. We all loved the location and even though we visited other neighborhoods for sights and eating, coming “home” at night is always pleasant and welcoming. Comfortable beds but next time I’ll ask for a choice of pillows. Standard ones are too firm. Would love to have in room ice buckets. We will be back next trip. As many mentioned the location is great.

Being someone who has visited NYC numerous times, this was a good choice of property to stay at this past Weekend (Dec 5-8) especially for someone who wants to do some Christmas shopping, and see all the decorations. upon arrival they had a room ready for my which I was Impressed. The room was very clean, the only complaint I have is I found the pillows to be uncomfortable and abit flight with no substance to them I would suggest updating them in the rooms to allow for better sleep quality. This hotel is in an amazing location near Columbus Avenue, short distance to Central Park and close to subways. I will be staying here again

From the lovely lobby to our beautiful corner suite room, we truly enjoyed our stay. The staff was friendly and efficient. We enjoyed cocktails at the roof top bar and a really delicious breakfast buffet with so many options! We will be return.

Rooms are a bit rough and poorly cleaned. Very loud. Staff was great. Location is convenient. Ran out of hot water one morning. Beer choice is limited. Door men are exceptional. Front desk is very friendly.

Short and sweet review. I thought this hotel was very very good upon entering for first glance expectations. Decor was lovely, staff were really helpful and was very professional. For me it was a great location very close to Central Park. Not too far away from Times Square either. Room was lovely but really really small.. a lot smaller than I had anticipated which wasn’t ideal as we had two cases of luggage. I love a hotel shower and this hotel shower was amazing but yet again the bathroom was tiny. I would definately stay again... infact when I return in 2020 I will be staying here again :-)

I love the atmosphere of the reception area and the comfortable, cozy rooms with great bedding. The location is also very convenient for my work. just a quick note, there is no coffee machine in the room but Starbucks is at the corner.

We just stayed in room 1124 at the Empire hotel. We were seeing an opera at the Met Opera; 50 feet away. Wonderful service at check in, fabulous room, great views, spacious, comfortable room. A delight. Wish the city was slightly quieter but that can’t be helped.

The Empire Hotel is a chic hotel with a great location. Just a few minutes from the new Nordstrom and many cute restaurants just steps away. Very helpful staff! Our room was clean. Bathroom is small and I will remember next time to ask for a tub but overall just a great little hotel.

My family and I needed a place to stay for Thanksgiving weekend and the Empire Hotel was a fabulous choice. The hotel Manger was truly fabulous along with the front desk staff. Everyone helped to make our stay a memorable and comfortable experience. We will definitely be back again!

The hotel and staff were very attentative to the needs of the clients. And it was great to be just a block away from the Macy's day parade. Literally under a five minute walk...Columbus Square. We were on the second row!

We recently stayed at the Empire Hotel for business. I was familiar with the hotel from the famous sign (of course!), and seeing the property on several blogger's Instagram feed. The hotel is located steps away from Lincoln Center, and convenient to the Columbus Circle metro stops. The interior is beautiful and sophisticated, with a great vibe to the lobby. Front desk crew and valet are all warm and extremely helpful. As with many NYC older hotels, the rooms can be stifling in the winter. We couldn't cool down our room from 76 degrees, so the front desk executed a switch right away. The updated rooms with doubles have a clever sleeping arrangement, with each bed placed apart, and the sq footage was a welcome surprise. The fitness center needs updating if that is an important part of your stay. But plenty of places to run right outside, not a deal breaker. If you need a quiet upper west side stay, I highly recommend The Empire Hotel.

Old and getting older. Great location next to the MET. ( This is getting comical, I have said what I wanted but it is not 200 characters so that leads me to rant about discrimination against people who have difficulties with written language )

This hotel is a disgusting rip off. I just checked into a tiny room that is not clean. A former tenants bathroom articles are still on the shelves in a bathroom so small that I have to go out of it in order to turn around. If I hadn’t booked a non refundable ( but still expensive!) Expedia price I would leave immediately, but I’m stuck here for 6 nights

Across the street from the Lincoln Center, quick walk to Central Park. Coffee and pastry shops close by. Subway entrance quick walk, hop on for a quick subway ride to anywhere. Came in for a show at the Beacon Theatre, a nice 13 minute walk, plenty of people around. The room needs work, our view was a wall with air conditioning units everywhere. Sun has no way in your room and the conditioning units always had water coming down from them so it was always looking like a rainy night! The bathroom was tiny, no place to put your things. The staff were very nice. You get free bottle water everyday but you have to ask at the front desk. We stayed on the first floor, took the stairs up and down-that was convenient. The location was perfect for us.

Great location, average room. Spacious king suite but bed was very hard and window was broken which allowed a lot of outside noise and smells to come inside. It was never fixed during our stay. Bell staff was very friendly and helpful. Lighting is a little dark in rooms and hallways. Food in their restaurant was delicious.

I stayed with my husband and friends at the Empire last week whilst visiting New York for the first time. We loved the location, its situated a couple of blocks away from Central Park and in walking distance from many of the must see places. The staff were friendly and helpful and the lobby and bar areas were well maintained. Unfortunately our room was very small with little to no view, one or the other would have been ok but it was very opressive. We ask to be moved to a different room and this was sorted for us within a couple of hours. Our room was so much better in both ways so we were very pleased. Our new room was ok, house keeping were great, but the decor finish wasn't great which ruined what could have been a lovely room. Also the bar prices were astronomical, if you stay here and fancy a night cap be prepared to pay way over the top.y

Love this hotel and staff, and proximity to the Opera. Also across the street from the Smith restaurant & bar which was fab. The rooftop lounge at Empire has a wonderful hot cider and inviting space to enjoy it. Nearby is Le Salle soup dumplings with next door package store to pick up wine. An awesome weekend.

My wife and I went to see "To Kill A Mockingbird" in NYC and stayed at The Empire Hotel while there.Convenient location across the avenue from Lincoln Center. Starbucks and P J Clarkes only steps away. Extremely friendly and helpful staff.

Was there for WOBI Conference across the street at Lincoln Center. Didn’t sleep a wink as the street noise from the 7th floor was as if we were actually on Broadway and not in an expensive hotel. Woke up to shower and get ready for the big first day and there was no water! Called the front desk, but they never picked up the damn phone! Went down to complain and they said they had no idea as they hadn’t received a complaint. No kidding! You didn’t answer the phone! Had to go to battle with management to get refunded. No one wants to unpack and then change hotels, but that is exactly what we did. The place is small, dark, and in need of maintenance. Front desk and door staff were polished, but it seems like they know the place kind of stinks. Too bad as it’s a great location. The profit margins must be huge as they are definitely not pumping anything back into their property. Must be a nightmare for the staff to always deal with all the angry customers.

Loved my visit to NYC. It’s nerve racking finding an affordable hotel hoping the photos on site match your experience. Well, Empire delivered! Lovely modern decor and friendly helpful staffing. Have already planned another trip to NYC with my girlfriends!

A friend and I stayed at the Empire Hotel for the first time and enjoyed the comfortable beds and perfect and safe location for the purpose of our trip. Proximity to Central Park, eateries, the Lincoln Center. Walking distance (15 min) to MOMA and shopping made it a perfect choice for us. The staff was helpful and friendly and mostly responsive to our requests. Bathroom lighting was passable, room pleasant and clean. Would stay here again.

The lobby is very nice and of course the location is great but the rooms suck and the manager and staff simply don't care. Was put in a handicap room with this weird diagonal shape and the worst bed you've ever slept on with tears in the bed skirts. Asked for a new room and the Manager simply told me that in 3 nights from now the hotel is oversold and didn't want to move me 2 nights later. Do yourself a favor and just stay somewhere else. Your back will thank you!!

I've been staying at the Empire Hotel since it's conversion from an apartment building in 2008 to the wonderful hotel it is today. The place just keeps getting better and better, if that's even possible. I would recommend the Empire Hotel to even my most finicky friends. It's spotless. Sexy and hip without pretense.

If you're a fan of the show Gossip Girl, you MUST stay at the Empire and have your own Blair Waldorf moments. The Gossip Girl cocktail on the rooftop lounge is a little pricey but so worth it. Plus,you're just a short walk through Central Park to where Chair got married and then venture a little north to sit on the steps at the Met. My only disappointment was that I couldn't get a photo of the iconic sign because the pool deck was closed for the season and that's the best angle to get the photo (come on Empire, at least open a little section of it for a couple hours a day for that photo op!)

the staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is outstanding, right near Central Park on the west side and right across from Lincoln Center which is beautiful. It's a great area in the sense that it's busy, but not crazy busy like Times Square can be. for the price I don't think you can do better than this hotel

I’ve been staying at the Empire Hotel since 2008. The place just keeps getting better and better, if that’s even possible! I would recommend the Empire Hotel to my most finicky friends. It’s spotless. Sexy and hip without pretense.

This was my second stay at this property . It won’t be my last. I was on vacation traveling alone. The staff was excellent from front door onRooms are relatively small, but clean and comfortable. House cleaning is great, love the shower.Location is excellent, you can walk almost everywhere you want to go in the city. Great steak house next door.

Booked online through ‘last minute.com’ first time visiting NYC as a family and I am appalled! The lobby is beautiful which draws you in however the rooms we got were awful! Not 4 star at all....The curtains are dirty, the walls had marks on it, the pillow cases had marks of makeup left on it, the mirror in the bathroom is rusted and the mirror in the room was not cleaned at all and the door in the bathroom needs to be repainted.I feel that I have wasted 5days here and wasted money that could’ve gone towards a better hotel and a much better room. When I put the complaint to the manager they showed me alternative rooms which were EXACTLY the same as the room I currently have and in he exact same state! I felt insulted and quite frustrated as we was on a flight for over 8 hours and it took us over 2 hours to get to the hotel due to traffic. I wouldn’t stay here again even if it was free!They then offered us free breakfast for 1 morning bearing in mind we were there for 5 mornings in total....1 free breakfast that costs around $28 does not come close to having to stay in the state of room that we we’re in for 5days.Not happy one bit!

We stayed at the hotel for my husband’s conference. I like running, the hotel is only a couple of blocks away from Central Park, I had an excellent run there. Columbia University is short subway ride away, and the station is 2 minutes walk from the hotel. Tons of great restaurants within walking distance. The front desk staff and the lobby bartenders are really friendly, a special shout-out to Pasquace at the front deck!!

Empire hotel is very well located, across Lincoln Center and various restaurants and cafes accesible in the area. Although the room was very small, I was surprised about the cleanliness of the room and bathroom upgrades. The staff is very kind and helpful also. Things to improve: room hearing/ac equipment and offering a coffee maker as a room amenity would be a real plus!

review_body: First the good things: Friendly staff and nice location between Midtown and the Upper West Side. Particularly good if you are planning on going to a concert/opera at Lincoln Center as it is right opposite it.We were given an accessible room and the size was good, which is pretty rare in New York.However, the furniture was dated and in some instances broken. The wardrobe was tiny and the bathroom was in bad condition. The shower wasn't working properly and needed patience and care to make it work.There is no room service as apparently the restaurant doesn't belong to the hotel. Didn't try the restaurant but had a look and wasn't impressed.All in all an OK experience, but i expected a bit more from a 4 star hotel.

The iconic Empire Hotel is a fantastic hotel to stay in for several reasons. The hotel has a fantastic location with transportation very close as well as restarants and coffee shops. It is just a block away from Central Park and across the street from Lincoln Center. When you arrive you immediately feel so welcome because the staff is fantastic from the doormen, front desk, bellman, housekeeping and even the engineer department. They are very friendly and go above and beyond to make sure you are happy with everything in their hotel. The ambiance is lovely and the iconic bar/ restaurant on top is awesome. The rooms are really nice and the beds and bedding are so comfortable. We feel like this is our home away from home especially now since we have stayed there a few times and plan to go back.

One of the best Hotel experiences I have ever had.Truly fabulous. Definitely be back. Such a comfortable and welcoming environment. From the moment I arrived I knew this was a great choice. Fabulous all round experience.

The Empire Hotel is a magnificent Hotel , with a great location and wonderfull Staff. Very kind, present and always there to help. i will high reccomanded to anyone love the spirit of the upper west side of Ny, Museums, cinemas. Theathers shops .. restaurants are around the corner . Very nice, safe and quite at night. Loved being there.

Hotel across from Lincoln center is close to shopping, dining, public transportation and entertainment. It is an older building with small bathrooms and very small closets. However, the room was spotless and the hotel had everything I needed. I will stay there again. The few problems I had were promptly addressed by housekeeping.

We booked this hotel through Virgin holidays, who we also booked our trip to New York through. We had never been to New York or America before so were unsure what to expect on both accounts. When we arrived at the hotel, there was a door person to assist with our luggage straight away who took us straight to reception. We were greated warmly at reception and given complementary bottles of water. The room we stayed in had two double beds and a bathroom with a toilet, basin and shower. Although the decor is slightly dated, we could not fault the hotel on cleanliness. The room was cleaned every day, with towels changed every day and the sheets were changed at least once during our stay. The hotel also had a turn down service which was a bonus. As for location, you cannot fault the hotel at all. It was about a 10/15 minute walk to Central Park and about 20/25 minutes to Times Square. We wanted somewhere that was not too central, but not to far out of the action either and this hotel was perfect. Directly surrounding the hotel, there are a number of places to eat and drink, and if you are looking for something quick for breakfast, I would definitely recommend breads bakery which is directly accross the road. The hotel will also store your bags for you on checkout day if needs be. Checkout time is 12pm, and our taxi wasn’t until 1pm so we choose to have one last walk around that morning before it was time to depart to the airport. The hotel was more than happy to keep our bags for us until we returned. Depending on traffic (and New York traffic can be pretty hectic) a ride to the airport can take anywhere from 1 hour to 2 hours. I would 100% recommend this hotel whether it’s your first time in New York or your a regular visitor.

Birthday celebration trip with my boyfriend. Very good and practical location near to Central Park, Columbus Circle and 20 min walking from Times Square.The hotel services are very good as well, lobby bar, rooftop lounge and breakfast.The rooms are nice! Apart from the room that we were given the 1st/2nd night, which had a problem with the air conditioning system, we tried to turn it off several times but didn't work, it was very noisy and vapor was coming out all night, the technician didn't solve it and was very rude. Fortunately they were lovely at the front desk and they solved the problem efficiently.

I arrived at the Empire Hôtel hôtel , after visiting my prior hotel and disappointed... I decided with my friend to try to book a room at the front desk... of the hotel.14 h flight ... we were so tired . we arrived at the front desk and by chance Pascalle attended us.He was so friendly, professional and most of all tried to help us. He suggested to book a room via booking as the hôtel was full completely. We got a room with 2 large beds and quite big for New York. Pascalle made everything to make our stay comfortable and pleasant: he also upgraded the room .The hôtel is nice and very close to all places and subway , few minutes from Central Park and around very nice restaurants.Thank you Pascalle for your excellent service, it was nice meeting youI will definitely return to this hotel and I hope you will be there to attend us...Very grateful Linda Amar

I spent a week at The Empire Hotel for business and I thoroughly enjoyed my experience.I had issues with any aspect of the hotel. New York is an expensive place to stay, so nowhere is going to be great value for money, as you would spend a lot for just a 2* in Midtown.The location was key for me, very close to Central Park and a few minutes from Metro Subway stations, close to shops. A very nice and welcoming hotel lobby and rooms that were perfect for someone travelling solo and on business. If you have the budget, I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and I would have no issues staying here again.

Great room, great location next door to Lincoln Center, great bar in lobby and a raw bar @ PJ Clark right next door!!! Walk across Central Park to the Metropolitan Museum of Art or down to Times Square and the theatre district. Empire is perfectly located for my taste. Rooms are a bit small but "get over it". Food all over the place and a friendly staff. There is no coffee maker in the rooms a Starbucks around the corner but I prefer the guy on the corner selling coffee from his cart. Parking one block south directly behind the hotel worked very well and a fair price. I'm coming back next Opera Season.

It’s nothing fancy. Or posh that’s for sure. It’s a place to lie your tired body down. This was one of the places offered to us at a discount for HSS. It’s not that much of a discount either. Nor close to HSS. It’s a 2 hours walk and 35 minute ride with the traffic. Rugs and window blinds pretty but very very dirty. Very tiny room. Very tiny bathroom. Vanities are cheap wood and tiny being so tiny they should be water proof or steam proof. No coffee station in the hotel. There’s Starbucks next door. Wasn’t an enjoyable place to stay for me at all.

I have always liked the hotel because of it's location, convenient to Columbus Circle, Lincoln center, easy access to subways, and close to good restaurants. Their staff has always been very helpful. If there has been any negative it has been the smaller size of the rooms. This time we stayed in a great room, much larger than we had stayed in before and a great value for the money relative to other hotels in the same area. Great stay and quite comfortable.

I woke up with a very sore throat and painful sinus. I checked the a/c unit which was filled with grime and dust. I was spending the day at auditions with my son - I felt awful the entire day. Someone needs to check this stuff!!!

Great staff, friendly service, nice Rooftop Lounge. Downstairs restaurant (attached to the hotel) was excellent for late night dinner after the opera. The best location for Lincoln Performing Arts visit. Rooms a bit worn and small. Overall great hotel.

review_body: This is the closest feeling to " Home away from Home "Great Hotel, incredibly friendly Staff, no better place I rather be while travelling.Every time I come to NYC, this is my place of choice.So conviniently located, near everything you can possibly want, yet , secluded enaough to avoid the crazyness

Great location. Steps from the Lincoln Centre. Close to Central Park & Met Museum. Easy subway access to all major attractions. Hotel room style was chic compact modern to match the design decor of the building interior and very quiet. Quality buffet breakfast available. Friendly and knowledgeable staff.

We came for a few days and loved it. The lobby and mezzanine is great for checking in to the free WiFi and having a drink. The roof top cafe and bar is great for a view and for breakfast buffet (at usd28)Our room was nice and big but we had to keep lowering the temperature time and again as it was a bit too hot. The location is perfect for visiting midtown museums and the Central Park. All within close proximity. It’s also walking distance to shopping and entertainment at Columbus square or the new Nordstrom.And it’s right next to Lincolncenter with opera house, ballet and the philharmonic orchestra. Totally perfect!!

Exceptional service and roomGreat location and value with a very polite friendly staff from the reception to the room attendant .The helpful doorman and very welcoming attitude was appreciated .Breakfast was on a rooftop, coffee was hot and smooth .I would definitely come back. This was my second stay here.

Price are cheap and the structure is very nice. The location it's quite and the close to subway stations. The staff is friendly and the food is pretty good. I suggest it to families and couple looking for a relaxing place.

Ridiculous. I booked a room and canceled it almost immediately using Booking.com and the charged me for the full price if the room. I even asked if I could just have a credit for a future stay and according to Booking.com, "the upper management declined." Completely unreasonable. I'm out about $200 for a room I never stayed in.

The Empire Hotel is a wonderful option for a NY stay for Lincoln Center performances as well as a general NYC visit. This was our first time staying there. Great NYC value for room and buffet breakfast. We will return.

I spent 2 nights at the hotel; Staff was pleasant and facility clean. On the other hand, the room was very shabby, especially the bathroom. The beds were fine, but the bedding was sparse and I needed extra blankets. Nothing felt luxurious here, but everything was adequate.

The Empire Hotel is a very fashionable, stylish hotel that exudes an energy and vitality that reflects its location. The location is wonderful and the staff always happy to assist. After finding our first room was noisy due to air conditioning, we were given a complimentary upgrade to an amazing room by the wonderful Luis. This is a hotel to celebrate in!

While there may be a little too much fresh paint here and there and our room did not have a bathroom fan, the staff is very pleasant and the sleep is restful. The location is remarkable. Columbus Circle, Lincoln Center, Central Park, The Smith for breakfast and Buloud’s bar, epicerie and restaurant. The Subway is also blocks away which is super convenient to get to Times Square and Penn Station.

I prepaid for three nights but was unable to arrive timely due to hurricane, flash flood, and severe thunderstorm warnings in the area. Despite the manager being totally lovely and understanding, corporate refused to refund the first night.

Luis at front desk is awesome! Our room was musty and without a view but Luis switched us easily to a beautiful room. I've stayed here a couple of times before; very clean. They could use more outlets near bedside and better bathroom lighting. This is a great location-close to subway, Lincoln center, great shopping and many restaurants--and one of the best rooftop bars in NYC!If you plan on imbibing in your room, however, bring your own glassware! Bartender in lobby lacked customer service skills.

Gem of a facility in prime location. We enjoyed the Empire and her charm. The rooms are smaller (as expected in an earlier NYC hotel but, very well cared for, Recommend avoiding the Rooftop Breakfast. Not a god representation of the quality of this hotel.

review_body: Knowing that the cost was almost 1/2 a chain hotel stay, I booked a larger room than I normally do- the junior suite. I thought that booking a larger room may increase my chance of a comfortable room on a higher floor with a good view. I was not wrong.The room was clean, comfortable bed and pillows, good clean bathroom with all standard amenities and at the end of the hall- quiet (still had some outside noise as expected with any hotel in NYC). There were 2 A/C units in room that provided a good continuous movement of air. I enjoy the white noise of the A/C units as it does help cover street noise easily and helps me sleep better. What was especially nice was the A/C units ran continuously so I didn't wake up like I normally do when typically hotel A/C units kick on and off and yet the temperature stayed constant as well.The only thing I didn't like was the ironing table. It was one of those little ones you put on top of a regular table. But, there are no regular tables in the room. It made ironing business shirts difficult. Iron itself was fine.As for the hotel and roof top lounge- clean, nice people, good hot breakfast buffet. I ate "dinner" late because of flight. So, no real entrees, just appetizers. Good food though. Note: no beer on tap.

Stay was just average with lot of niggles (air conditioning, bathroom condition, etc.). Stayed only one night - so wasn't enough time to complain and get anything fixed. But certainly not worth the price/night.

Issues at check in, and getting card holds refunded. Front of house staff and manager aloof, admitted they are doing differently to their hotel policies, but didn’t seem remotely bothered No effort at all to help resolve the issue. Plenty of other good hotels in NYC that are easy to stay at

Hotel ok, room was tired and in need of a make over. Shower curtain in bathroom sticks to you when using the shower.Tea/Coffee making facilities would be nice.Noise from street below was loud.Late checkout was expensive.

The Empire hotel does not disappoint. Traveling from California, early check in was a great add-on - we were able to occupy the room early and the room was wonderful. The location, great service from the front door to the front desk to the housekeeping staff, all very adept and polite. We are ready to go again!

It's hard to beat the location of the Empire Hotel in New York City, directly across the street from Lincoln Center, and a few blocks away from Central Park and Columbus Circle. The staff was great from making reservations right through to getting our car from the valet. I had a big event nearby and had family coming in for it, and we all decided to stay at the Empire, and everyone was very happy we did.The rooms and bathrooms are somewhat small and the wifi was out for a little while at night - but the staff apologized and explained they were doing maintenance. The "resort" fee seems a little silly, but in general the price is very competitive for NYC, and for the location, great rooftop bar (a perfect spot for a small party after my event), and the fantastic staff, I know it will be our choice again in the future!

Amazing place, good atmosphere, great staff and best position near by Central Park and very close to Lincoln Center. Room clean Suggestion: - having “aperitivo” in the pool deck- going to the gym - spending relax time in the hall with its charming design

We had a very enjoyable stay at the hotel. It is literally a 30 second walk from Lincon center, and the 1, 2 and 3 line underneath. The hotel has a rooftop restaurant/bar, with finger foods and drinks, which were a bit expensive, but par for Manhattan. Two biggest things: condition of the rooms and the resort fee. the rooms, most specifically, the bathrooms, need updating. Paint is peeling, doors and roughed up, etc. There are several pictures from other guests, so you can find them on here. Also, the resort fee is a joke. I will be challenging them, as $22 for a hotel that does not have a pool open, and I don't intend to use the gym is basically charging you for internet (which they aren't allowed to do) and water. OTHERWISE, this was a good, albeit a bit expensive, stay. If you want access to the Lincoin Center area, I would stay again.

review_body: Loved the room, loved the bar and rooftop lounge. The drinks were outstanding. Food was delish. Prices were fair. The bartender at the lobby bar was outstanding, and he even remembered me from a previous trip. The bed was cozy and the room was very quiet. I would highly recommend the Empire!

Upon arrival I requested a room on a higher floor and was told the hotel was sold out which was a lie.Upon entering the room I immediately noticed some small stains and hair on the sheets. My husband called to inform the front desk and we were quickly moved to a different room which was tiny my husband and myself couldn’t fit in the bathroom together as we needed to get ready for our dinner. we requested a different room because the new room was just to small. The third room was better but the bathroom outlet didn’t work so I had to do my hair in the bedroom. We stay in the city almost every weekend and expect to enjoy our room and hotel amenities. this was a disappointing experience and we will definitely not return for a stay. The manager was also rude he came upstairs to complain about noise when we just returned from dinner in the lounge I felt they were just annoyed because we complained. The security also denied our guests entry because it was after hours which I’ve never experienced. We stay at so many amazing hotels and this one is definitely not on the list. The best part of our stay was the upstairs lounge but I wold not recommend this hotel.

Beware for 'specials': they still total what the original price is. Location is great, the staff is wonderful. the hotel, past the entry, is very poorly decorated, run-down. Tiny room ($750/2 nights!), a bathroom too small to change your mind in and a 'view of the courtyard....' which doesn't exist. (Room 910) Temp set for 78º day which could not be changed. Enormous equipment noise with the window open for air, stifling when closed. I was told, by phone, that parking, 'all in' was $55/24hrs no in/out. Understood. At check out we were told it was over $150 incl taxes. "Do you remember the name of the person on the phone you spoke with (last week)?". I thought I did, but that doesn't make it not true! A typical evasive way to deal with this. Yes, I travel a great deal globally and am aware of a wide variety of prices. The location by Lincoln Center couldn't be better which is why we stayed there. but the room given was not the 'view' that had been advertised for this choice and the heat was inexcusable. nice, Fast elevators :-D, great staff all around.

The Empire is across the street from the Met where we went to the Baron Fund Conference on the 25th. The hotel room was small but the convenience was great, because it was so close. The staff were exceptional from the time we checked in with Emir who was very helpful, polite and patient, to the rooftop bar staff who were exceptionally in their service. Can’t leave out Ray whose friendliness and sense of humor made us all laugh.

AWFUL experience. The beds are extremely small and uncomfortable. The room is so gross. Lampshade has a stain all over it. My sheets had a stain. The wood in the bathroom was molded and chipping. By far worst experience.

Booked a King bed deluxe room with my partner, we were given 2 separate beds, we were not told about it - with a 10h flight and arrival at midnight it was a very bad surprise. We were promised the room we booked next day and told to pack and store our bags until the room was ready, when we were back to check in to our new room we were told it was not available and that we had to go back to our old room. Terrible experience, over rated over priced terrible hotel. Fortunately we were able to find a much better replacement nearby.

This bar on the top floor of the hotel has some wonderful views. The issues are very inattentive service and appetizers of poor quality. They do have happy hour pricing but getting service is clearly an issue. I would return except for the very careless manner in n which it runs. I am frankly surprised that this place functions at all. The personal here are hired firvtge it looks snd certainly not fir brains. Very disappointing

review_body: Great reception area that’s it , room are stylishly decorated to within an inch of their life but entirely dysfunctional , street noise is continuous service is slow , renovated recently on a low budget, cheap and a bit nasty

From the moment you walk in you know this is not a typical hotel. The atmosphere is one that you don't see in a chain hotel. There is a New York posh feel, but not stuffy. It looks like a lobby is supposed to look. Inviting and not just the 1st floor.I stayed in a Junior Suite, so I cannot complain about space, though I chose this to have plenty of room. The bed was comfortable and the furniture was a nice change of pace. The only downside is that the desk is directly below the TV. It's uncomfortable to work on a laptop and watch, so I just turned the TV off. There is noise from the street, but my room was facing Broadway, so honking can be expected at all times of day.The food options are limited, but you are in New York City. Finding a restaurant is not a problem. You can always order in if you don't mind going to the lobby for a pickup. Overall, I would stay here again. But, these rooms are not for families.

Terrific service from the doormen, front desk, and housekeeping. Very clean, very fair price, and PJ Clarke’s (adjacent bar and restaurant) was terrific service and very good food. Excellent experience and I’ll definitely be back.

Would give a zero if I could, the lobby and position of the hotel is lovely.... and misleading the reception area was filled with guests complaining, the expensive rooms were tiny, dark and unclean even toilets had not been flushed, hair-clips on window sills, carpets old worn and grotty not at all like the pictures on the website. Its noisy (not the usual noise from New York City Streets or even other guests) but the humongous cluster of ancient AC units outside the windows that were so earsplittingly loud they sounded like aircraft engines and literally shook the rooms.  The hotel is very aware of the problem which looking on this site it was reported in 2017. It is now 2019. They thoughtfully use the tiny rooms and noise problems to scam unfortunate guests into paying for different rooms - which was as noisy as the first! Just more expensive.... Other family members were shown different rooms and suffered the same fate. Upon joining the unhappy throng of disappointed guests to complain, we met a delightful female manager who along with being generally unhelpful aggressively claimed that she "did not build the hotel" refused to refund so we could book elsewhere (we had only spent one hour in the filthy building) . Our first night of a family holiday in New York was ruined along with lots of other guests so very surprised to see any good trip adviser scores I can only assume they were written and paid for by the hotel to scam the unwary traveller.

Beautiful and friendly atmosphere and it truly felt like a get away from heaven! The roof top lounge was amazing, drinks were delicious and my girlfriend and I had totally complete silence, which is the main thing we were looking for

Our experience with Empire Hotel was superb! When we got to the hotel we realized our room was small for our family of four so we requested that we change rooms to a bigger room and the front desk-- Jeffrey to be exact was very helpful. He showed us other options right away and we changed room. Althought the room design was abit dated, the cleanliness was on point. The bellhop, housekeeping and everyone was very polite and helpful as well. Even the hotel manager was very personable, extremely helpful and service oriented. Aside from the service, its location to all the places we wanted to go to was easy. Central park was only a few blocks away! We loved our stay so much we booked our last leg of the trip with this hotel again.

Check in was very quick and easy when we arrived and we had Queen rooms booked which were small but enough room for 2 people. The room had a massive flat screen TV, fridge, hair dryer, iron and ironing board and the alarm clock had USB charging points in it which I used to charge my smart watch and phone each night. The small clothes hanging area is in beside the safe and fridge and was ok for shirts etc but no good for long maxi dresses which had to hang over the edge as they were too long for the space - no great inconvenience. The bed was comfortable and everything worked as it should but the noise from the AC system was deafening at times. My husband had to wear ear plugs but I was so tired from the walking I managed just fine. The bathroom was very small but the shower was large and really powerful which I've never experienced in the States before. Bathroom was a bit tired and could do with a revamp but was clean. Housekeeping in general was very good, room was cleaned, towels restocked, never ran out of toiletries etc. They give you soap, shampoo, conditioner and body wash in the bathroom.We used the restaurant in the hotel for breakfast most mornings which is $25 per person for a buffet breakfast which includes the usual continental items such as cereals, fruits, pastries etc but there are also hot options such as french toast, pancakes, sausages, eggs and bacon and there is an omelette station too. We were very happy with the quality of the breakfast items and the view out of the restaurant is amazing.Hotel was close to a couple of subway stations as well as some lovely restaurants and was only a block away from Central Park. Having a Starbucks next door is a big plus for us too - we love a wee coffee in our rooms at the end of a long day. We were travelling in a group of 3 couples, we had no issues with our room (apart from AC noise) but one couple's AC didn't work but they spoke with reception and it was fixed very quickly. The other couple had an issue with their TV remote and again it was fixed very quickly - no complaints about the service. I certainly would stay here again - but make sure we request a quieter room :)

I arrived at the hotel at 630 pm. My room was NOT READY. No offer of a drink at the bar while I waited almost 45 mins for the room to be available. Bathroom needs a complete redo. Don't work out in the fitness center. The smell of mold is OVERWHELMING and the treadmill shuts off repeatedly during attempt at a workout. Turn the heat down.

We stayed here for 4 nights. The room was fairly small but very clean. The room had a safe, small hanging space, hair drier, tv, iron and ironing board & AC. The AC was really quite loud during the night but we were so tired we were able to sleep through it. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooftop bar has nice views and good cocktail menu. Great location beside the Lincon Centre and with a short walk to Central Park and subway. Would stay here again.

no working blow dryerac unit noise level unbearable, rooms are very smalloverall experience diminished by no response to obtain a dryer and very loud and barely functional ac unit. good rooftop bar and location.

If you want a room where you sleep next to the equivalent of a jumbo jet's motor then this is the place for you. The room was right next to the hotel's engine room. I complained and they told me to go to the shop next door and buy some ear plugs!!!!!!!!! The roof top is good though. They advertise a pool but check that it has water in it at the time you have booked for. Wasn't in use when I was there even though it was hot. All the staff that rely on tips are absolutely delightful. The others are fair to woeful. My new room's air-conditioning was hot in the night and freezing during the day. A technician came but didn't fix it. I got fed up with complaining and decided to give up getting my phone and my air-conditioning fixed and concentrated on having a good time and finding another hotel to stay in. GO TO THE BEACON HOTEL ON BROADWAY AND 83 STREET. IT IS FANTASTIC. EVERYTHING WORKS AND ALL THE STAFF IRRESPECTIVE OF WHETHER THEY RELY ON TIPS ARE WONDERFUL. It doesn't have a roof top but the rooms are bigger and cleaner with a small kitchenette and the evening bar is great with good bar food. Ask for a room facing Broadway and away from the elevators. It is also in a great area across the road from the famous Fairway Supermarket and with lots of cafes nearby. It is one block from 72 station which has express trains which is a real advantage.

We go to the Metropolitan Opera a few times a year and always stay at the Empire. Excellent value for the location, always clean and the staff is always very helpful and welcoming. We don’t see a reason to stay anywhere else.

I stayed here for three nights. Staff was very friendly, got us into our room before lunch on check in-day. Great location, right across the street from Lincoln Center. Room was quite large for NYC. They offer same day laundry which I enjoy. The lobby bar is nice but the hidden gem in the rooftop bar, it’s a great spot. Groovy retro feel and look, partially open air. Solid cocktail served, staff seemed pleasant. Had a rooftop yoga thing happening in the mornings.

This hotel is in the best location in Manhattan, many of restaurants near by and directly across from the Lincoln center, access to the subway and walking distance to Columbus circle and the Hudson river.

The Empire Hotel is still a great place for conferences and convenient to Lincoln Center and Broadway. I enjoyed my stay, with only one exception: the heating and cooling system needs work. P. J. Clarke’s is a wonderful restaurant for dinner. The Rooftop Lounge is delightful.

The Empire Hotel is fantastic, the location near Lincoln Center is ideal. I have stayed several times and have booked 3 more in the coming months. The rooftop is amazing with beautiful views and attentive staff. Valet parking is an added plus, and once after driving away, I realized that I had left my phone in the room. I drove back and the doorman told me to stay in my car and he retrieved it for me. That is extraordinary service.The room is comfortable and nicely appointed and I had a refrigerator for my meds,Check-in and out is super easy and the agents are most kind,

This hotel is in a great upper west side location. Right across the street from the Lincoln Center and very close to several good restaurants and close enough to other good UWS restaurants and attractions. We were happy to see that the lobby and mezzanine were redecorated. Although the rooms are cozy (read small), if offers good value for the price. And if you require more room book a deluxe king.

The hotel is very comfortable. We enjoyed the roof top very much, and the lobby bar with it's small plates. The location is great, because we could walk to many things, and there are two metro stops very close by.

Staying at The Empire Hotel was so noisy, it felt like you were sleeping on the street, we did ask to move to a quieter part of the hotel but the staff weren't very helpful or accommodating at all even though the housekeeping told us other rooms were available in the quieter part of the hotel. The bathroom was unclean with mould on the shower screen and bath, there were toiletries for only 1 person even though there were 3 people in the room. the curtains were badly stained as was the bedsheet and my daughter was bitten after sleeping in one of the beds. I also noticed they over charged us as we have a food bill for the lounge which we never ordered, so overall very poor. Lastly we had problems as we couldn't get wifi in our room, we wasted a lot of our time having to wait in our room for it to be fixed eventually two days later they fed a wire from the hallway with the router hanging from the wire and balanced it behind our door.

This hotel is wonderful for the explorer type and Gossip Girl fanatic. Overall a great stay. Very close to Times Square, Central Park and next to a couple really good food stops. If you want to explore more it's also very close to the subway. I would also recommend going to the rooftop at night for drinks and a late night snack.

Nice Staff, Excelent location, near Central Park, Columbus Circle and lots of shop!Special thanks to Maggi... friendly, Nice and cordial!Recommend...clean, quiet and very nice Hotel! Our home in NYC...

Hotel decor is tres chic, prices awesome, location central to the best of the city. Empire Rooftop serves magnificent views of the city, great food and drinks on comfy leather couches. Staff pamper you and coffee magnifico, too! Make a weekend of it.

My wife and I have stayed at the Empire Hotel twice now when traveling to see the Met Opera at Lincoln Center. It's reasonably priced for its location. The rooms are nicely appointed and the staff is friendly and helpful.

Hello, my wife and I spent a total of 10 days at the Empire Hotel. First of all, I have to say that we felt very comfortable there and recommend the hotel to everyone. The hotel and decor has come down a bit but it has a little more charm. The rooms are clean and the staff is really more than friendly. We had two special concerns and they were both fulfilled. Especially Nohan, the friendly front desk manager, was very accommodating and gave a lot of good tipss for our stay. The location is perfect, you are not right in the loud core of the city but can also have its peace. You get along well everywhere.

Perfect location, nice lobby, easy check in. However, room too hot, room looked into air shaft above center air conditioning machinery. Constant loud din. Blanket too heavy and hot with nothing in between. For the price, even in NYC, a beautiful lobby doesn’t make up for those conditions in the room.

This is a 3 star hotel directly across from the Lincoln Center and 3 blocks from Columbus Circle. 15 min walk to Times Square, 1 block to Central Park. Surrounded by good restaurants. The staff is great, professional and friendly. The decor of the hotel can be described in a lot of ways - eclectic, odd, bizarre, ugly? Rooms are NYC small, although comparable to the competition. It's not great value for money, but not bad either. You just have to get your head around that in NYC $200 doesn't get you the same as in a lot of other places. Some details of the finish were shoddy - the bathroom door had been repaired with drywall mud or wood putty and not sanded, as had a large section in the main room. Not terrible, just not quite the quality of details I would expect. Internet was variable - sometimes great other times not. Would I stay here again - I would probably try to find somewhere else to try.

We stayed here as part of a package with TUI and while the photos show it as quite glamorous, the rooms and decor are a little dated. We had booked a twin queen room, but on arrival were shown to the smallest room I have ever seen with a single queen bed squeezed in. Needless to say, we turned straight around and spoke to reception, who confirmed we had in fact been booked into a queen room as per the request from TUI. There was no problem upgrading and luckily they had a junior suite available, which is what we wanted in the first place. I Can't fault the staff as they were always friendly and very helpful. The location is very good and for first time New Yorkers like ourselves, wasn't too much of an assault on the senses. We arrived late on the first day due to customs taking 3 hours! Yes, 3 hours at JFK. Anyway, by the time we arrived and were able to sort out our room, we were so tired, we just wanted somewhere local to have a bite to eat. Luckily, there is an American style restaurant just on the corner called PJ Clarkes and we had a very pleasant beer and a burger. The next morning we had breakfast just across the road at The Smith, which has great reviews and while we were there was always very busy. If you're staying in the area, I would suggest you eat here at least once as the food is excellent and sets you up for the day. Finally, if you need a quiet room to sleep, I would s suggest staying somewhere where the air conditioning isn't so loud. My wife had to were eat plugs it was that loud. I find it hard to believe that you can go to what are considered 2nd world countries and they have whisper quiet air con and this hotel has what sounded more like an industrial fridge rattling around in the background!

Found this hotel on a recommendation from someone that works at Lincoln Center. We were going to New York to see an Opera and a Broadway show. It is literally across the street and very convenient. Really nice hotel. It was clean and well maintained. The room was very nice. The building is old but it is kept in excellent condition. The staff was friendly and helpful.I will most definitely stay here again.

Only stayed for 2 nights, but the visit was well worth the money. The hotel is located on a key spot in Manhattan, walking distance from Central Park, Columbus Circle and the Lincoln Center (Opera, Ballet, Music). I especially liked the friendliness and flexibility of the staff (reception, restaurant, etc). For example: I lost my keycard, and it was no hassle getting it replaced, in 3 minutes I had a new one. My room wasn't big, but that is no problem; I was only there to sleep. Bathroom ok - very good 'rain shower'. One thing for improvement: the airconditioing is old and its noise can be a nuisance. Tip: bring earplugs (which I always have with me during traveling)

The Hotel Empire is right in the middle of everything we wanted do do in NYC. Close to the park, museums, Times Square, etc.. The decor is funky and hip, not at all boring. The bellmen at the front door are extremely helpful and friendly. Overall a great stay.

Check-in was poor. Staff left me standing for 5 mins while she went somewhere with no explanation and no apology when she returned. Rooms do not have coffee makers and there is no coffee in the lounge. Rooms do not have functioning thermostats. Location is great for Lincoln Center but that's about the hotel's only virtue.

Stayed on the first floor with inward facing room. The noise from the industrial ventilation system which was outside our windows was completely unacceptable. Exit to roof top bar needs a bit of a refresh. Staff were very friendly.

Lovely hotel, comfortable bed and quiet (even for Manhattan!). The roof-top bar has wonderful views and position for sunsets. Close to Central Park and north Manhattan. Times Square in walking distance. Across the road from one of the best restaurants - The Smith!

LOVE the location - right across from Lincoln Center! Well appointed room and very friendly, helpful staff. This is our go-to hotel for our yearly New York City adventure. The rooftop lounge has an amazing view! We’ll be back....

On a positive note the hotel is in a great location in front of the Metropolitan Opera. The room is in serious need of updates and the carper was dirty. The heating/cooling unit was very outdated, had buttons which did not function. In my last night the cooling unit stopped working, began to heat in a dangerous way and the temperature in the room rose to 85 degrees. The technician fixed it but he did not clean the filter that was completely dirty and could be the cause of overheating.

The hotel has a great location. All workers were very nice and friendly. The room was clean, quiet, it was pretty small but we had everything we needed there. We sure enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Definitely recommend!

This pricey hotel has a cool lobby bar and rooftop bar but otherwise, skip it. Tiny bathrooms, small rooms, dark, claustrophobic hallways with strange wallpaper that makes you feel uneasy. Staff doesn't seem to know what is going on when you ask questions. No coffee machine in rooms and no free coffee anywhere in hotel and no room service....big mistake.

review_body: Highly recommend this hotel. I don’t often write reviews, but when I do it’s to celebrate a real find. Our exceptional experience here was due to the outstanding staff. From the moment we arrived, I felt welcomed and appreciated. Lovely Maggi at the front desk is the epitome of graciousness. You knew right away you were in the good hands of someone who really cared about you and making you feel comfortable. Her natural elegance elevated the check-in experience. I also enjoyed the humor and courtesy of Chris at the front desk that morning. We came in after a red-eye which can be a grind. The professionalism and personal touch of each member of the staff helped start my stay in New York off right. Eugene at the front door was the personification of hospitality. He continued to be a valuable resource for me throughout my stay – recommending some outstanding options for morning coffee and other helpful answers to my many questions. Best of all, when I needed some service outside of his hours on duty (like car service for our trip to the airport), he connected me with his colleagues Brandon who, along with Naz, continued the standard Eugene set for me of excellent service from the Empire Hotel staff. The hotel building is over 100 years old and I enjoyed the charm of the vintage touches. The pushbuttons inside the elevators have a patina that remind you of all the history in the building. The main lobby is dark and cool (perhaps in keeping with the bar area it encloses), but still comfortable with lots of seating and a grand staircase to the mezzanine. Our 6th floor room was cozy, but included a large bed, dresser, desk, and two chairs. I loved the bold choice of the dark print wallpaper in the hallways. Our room had a big window with a nice view of the street. I never heard noise from adjacent rooms and only the occasional activity in the hallways. The bathroom had a terrific shower! It had both an overhead rain-shower and hand-held wand options. Not much counterspace around the sink, but lots of shelf space nearby. There was a small refrigerator in the closet. Also in the closet – a sturdy full-size umbrella the hotel provides for you to use during your stay (you can take it home for an additional $30 charge to your room). No in-room coffee, but you do get two free bottles of Fiji water each day (which you pick up yourself from the front desk). An innovation I really enjoyed was the magnetized “do not disturb/please make up the room” sign. You just stick it on the outside of your door with the appropriate message facing out. No more annoying door-hanging signs fluttering away when you close the door. Be sure to visit the rooftop restaurant!! Stunning views from multiple levels. Coffee and a menu as well as a full bar. The Empire Hotel location is outstanding – across the street from Lincoln Center and a Duane Reade drugstore right around the corner. We had terrific meals at restaurants on the same block. You can quickly connect to all the city has to offer via close by subway or a cab. A tiny park across the street is a welcome oasis when you want a break. The Empire Hotel is a gem that shines bright thanks to the good people who work there.

Nice but noisy hallways. Doors constantly slamming all night. Comfortable bed. Nice shower. Plenty of hot water. Good for an overnight stay. Decent price. Hallway decor is disgusting. Loud and distracting.

Our last stay at the Empire was highlighted by excellent service and attentive staff. After a long couple of days moving a family member, we arrived late to helpful valet and door staff, as well as a very kind front desk representative who upgraded our room and went out of her way to take care of our family. We have had spacious and quiet rooms every time we stay at the Empire, with fabulous views!

We have had a thoroughly enjoyable few nights stay at this hotel. It is modern, comfortable, attractive and ideally situated to explore the New York City attractions. It also has a great roof top bar and outside roof area. Its situation on W 63 St is located close to the Lincoln Center and nearby subway stations. Front of desk representative Pasquale was particularly helpful to us

We stayed in NYC for two weeks this summer mostly visiting friends but wanted a few nights with a pool in a good location so our boys who are 6 and 9 could take a dip to escape the heat. Entrance and doormen were very lovely and welcoming, great lobby and a good start to our stay. We were given a very nice room overlooking the street with a slight view of central park and lovely buildings opposite. Bathroom was smallish but nice enough. The pool however was disappointing. We all laughed out loud when we first saw it as it was much smaller than we had anticipated but was happy enough and not overly surprised as the hotel seemed good value for a pool and the UWS location. Annoyingly however the pool had such high levels of chlorine that after half an hour on day 1 our eldest son couldn't even swim in it as his eyes stung so badly. Throughout the day other children visited the pool and complained of the same thing-burning and stinging eyes. It was so bad that their eyes totally puffed up and they didn't even want to go in it. You could smell it strongly on their swimwear. We did complain about it to the pool attendant but nothing was done. it remained that way throughout our stay. Although sadly, he was filling in for someone else apparently so he was pretty disinterested. Such a shame as that was the point of us staying in a hotel and not with friends. The deck itself was small but fine and the bar/roof top was very nice with fantastic views and helpful staff. All in all I would recommend this hotel but do not book here for the pool, especially if it's for children. It's fine if you literally want a plunge pool to cool down in.

Stayed here for 2 nights. First impressions of this lovely hotel was good, looked a little shady from the outside, but when you walk in, you are greeted by a concierge who welcomes you, the inside is very modern at looks exclusive. Front desk personal are helpful og and very nice. You get a free Fiji water every day!! The hotel position is great, nearby subway will take you any where, at is minutes from the hotel. Central Park and Columbus cirkel is right outside. Great area. We got an upgrade on our room, so we got at superior room with 2 queen size beds . Unfortunately there is a big noisy ventilation-tube right out side our window. The staff was understanding and offered us a new room. . The bathroom could use and major update. I would definitely stay here again. This is one of the best hotels I have stayed in.

Four star but should be three stars. It took us 3 attempts to get a decent room. The first room was the size of half a shoe box with a night stand that kept toppling over. Room 2 was bigger but was like being in the bowels of a ship with a horrendous noise from a kitchen extractor fan and sewage coming out of the bath tap. Room 3 was passable, that's the best I can say. The internet is NON existent in the rooms.The roof terrace is nice but you get told repeatedly that ALL the tables are reserved. The only good thing about this place is it's proximity to the Lincoln Center and Central Park.

Think of New York, think of the Empire State Building, and rightly so. Although not as tall as expected and the views not as spectacular as the TOTR, the ESB us still a must when it comes to NYC. Unfortunately you can't do the button pressing scene from Elf as you go up in different elevators, but the build up and views are worth a journey.

really enjoyed the stay, very nice hotel, lovely rooftop bar, excellent service ! would definitely say there again, lots of restaurants in the area, subway only a few steps away... lovely Lincoln Center just behind the corner, very nice

Very good service. Hotel is in desperate need of renovation. Location is excellent. Staff is very good. The condition of the hotel is deteriorating. They no longer have coffee pots in the rooms which is totally unacceptable.

Overall the Hotel was expensive, but that is expected for NY. The rooftop very nice view.We had 2 drinks only and price was $40. Bathroom was not comfortable. couldn't figure out the shower set up and the sink was designed with not much space between the faucet and the basin.

I can’t say I was disappointed in this hotel, because I had read the comments on TripAdvisor before arrival (someone else booked for me) and was warned. But I can say that everything negative that has been written about this hotel is true – and more.I was originally given a room with an air conditioner that did not function. But it was the middle of the summer! The temperature outside was 35 degrees celsius / 90 Fahrenheit. The room needed a functioning air conditioner desperately. The curtains were torn and the shades were broken. Not good for a room full of afternoon light. I complained, but was told there were no other rooms, I complained louder – and they relented, but only when someone went up to see if I was telling the truth. Go figure.The rest of this review is about the new (second) room and the hotel itself.There is Good, there is a lot of Bad and some Ugly.THE GOOD: The lobby is spacious and quite hip in its tackiness. I liked the lobby bar, although expensive, and they don’t offer complimentary peanuts or pretzels. You have to buy snacks and that, too, is pricey, but all in all, it was a comfortable place to hang out in and have a drink after a busy day. Most of the receptionists were quite nice – if you weren’t complaining. Unfortunately there was so much to complain about that in the end it tried their nerves and mine. But there were a couple who kept their cool and remained charming.The location is excellent. My room looked out over Lincoln Center.Once I finally got a room with a functioning air-conditioner, the air conditioner worked fine and was not at all loud, thank goodness.The bed was great, as well as the assortment of pillows.My room was spacious (it was more expensive than a standard double, a Deluxe King).Housekeeping did a good job.THE BAD: The roof-top bar was extremely loud and crowded. It was hard to carry on a conversation. The pool was tiny. Actually, ridiculous.The rooms I and my friends occupied were VERY tired, almost shabby. The switch on the standing lamp was broken, so it was hard to turn on and off. The window shades were hard to pull up and down, but they did work. The furniture was chipped, the rug had stains, the bathroom is tiny and there is very little shelf space. The safe was placed at the bottom of the night table, cramped in between the bed and the window. You had to get down on your knees to open it and put things in. Very uncomfortable. THE UGLY:The windows were filthy!The Internet was a joke and was integrated into the stupid resort fee of $25.00 a day! The Internet was sloooow and I and my friends were continually, any time of day or night, bumped out – right in the middle of reading something or writing an email or whatever. We complained. And complained. And finally they did not charge us the resort fees.All in all: if I didn't have to, I wouldn't come here again. It was chosen because it was a five-minute walk from where we had to be and was reasonably priced. But in the end, I would rather pay a bit more and feel like the owner of the hotel really cared.

My granddaughter and I stayed at the Empire hotel because we were attending the NYC Ballet. The room was a “Superior double bedded bedroom”....hardly superior, very mediocre. Very dark, one lamp in the room, 75o and could not adjust temp. Bathroom very tired and really no amenities. Staff was great. Fairly expensive for one night.

Opera fans take note! Top your evening off after the performance at the Lincoln Center with a First Class night if sleep. Be sure to stop by the beautiful rooftop restaurant before or after the show for the stunning views and ultra cool vibes.

This has been my third stay at the Empire Hotel and I have to say, from the moment you check in, the staff are fantastic, the rooms are clean and lovely, the showers are the best, the products they give you make you feel like you are at a spa, the housekeeping is kind and helpful. I highly recommend staying here.

review_body: Had a wonderful few days here. Room was spacious and bright and clean. Comfortable bed with nice bed linens. Front desk staff were incredibly nice and helpful. My only negative comments are:1. the pool area.. the reason I chose the hotel was because there was a pool with loungers to relax by. But there was very loud music playing continually so I couldn’t use this area. What a pity. It could be so nice up there. My friend and I went up to have lunch but didn’t stay because of the loud music. I understand having music in the bar on the floor below, but why not make the pool area peaceful and relaxing? Surely It’s what people need in a busy city like NY?- Twice I found a small cockroach in my bathroom. The bathroom and bedroom were very clean so cleanliness wasn’t an issue, but the hotel needs to do something about its pest control. I don’t want this to spoil my review as I was very happy in the hotel (apart from the pool). But just something they need to deal with.

Poorest quality renovation both in terms of decoration and amenities! Tinny rooms, poorly decorated with no taste or intention. Room light switch hard to access; door could not be open as it hit the closet which displayed deep scratches in its poor quality. (forget wood!). Actually the doors of the closet could not fit to close completely.

The hotel and rooms are very clean. The front desk staff and bellmen were very nice and knomlegeable. The security can use some serious work. I was only asked once in passing if I was staying at the hotel upon entering and was never asked to show a key. Anyone can walk right into the hotel and get on the guestroom elevators. The hallway lighting outside our particular room 415 was very dim, almost dark. The rooftop bar service was terrible. Had trouble getting a seat on the outside patio when the patio was near empty and our waitress had to ask us twice for our drink order. She also neglected to place our appetizer order so we cancelled that. We had planned to have dinner at the Hotel but after receiving terrible service in a near empty bar we went elsewhere.

We were very pleased with our choice of hotel for sight seeing in New York. It was very close to, Central Park, the Metropolitan Opera House, shopping on 5th Avenue, Times Sqare and the Empire State Building. The hotel was very comfortable, and the staff were very helpful.

The location is good. A couple of stops on the subway $3 or 15 min walk to times square. Very helpful staff room was very clean. Roof top is lovely but happy hour on Thursdays doesn't extend there. Lobby is beautiful and good wi fi.We had the most amazing cheesecake at the Italian over the road, try it! Highly recommend a stay here.

Poorly maintained hotel with poor amenities. Wardrobe and carpet were in very bad shape. Room lighting was bad. Location good. Bell staff good. Rest of the hotel was horrible. Skip it. Not worth the money paid.

I went to this hotel with my partner for 4 days, room okay but no kettle to make tea or coffee which was a disappoint as most hotels have this was advised when booking the pool would be open that's why we booked the hotel in the first place but to our disappointment it was closed, when checking out we never got asked if wee enjoyed our stay, just took our key.

Excellent location central to the subway and park. Rooftop bar was excellent and an extensive menu to match. Could not fault the service or rooms. Short walk to delicious other food options and a good supermarket right below

As you walk in, The Empire Hotel almost feels like a 5 star hotel. The service and staff at the front desk were excellent. The rooms are ok. Nothing to brag about, but if all you need the room for is to sleep then it's acceptable. The room and bathroom were very clean. The issue with the room is the poor lighting and the very loud air conditioning unit. The WiFi was not reliable. The coffee in the room was not complimentary and the price for the coffee ($3.00 US per coffee pod) was not included in the price list of items available in the fridge. Hence why I assumed the coffee was complimentary and only found out on my invoice.

Location is all Empire has going for it. The rooms are very small, bathroom very basic and cramped, and ACs are super loud! Defitnitely not great value for money! The rooftop has a very cool view though.

The overall experience was not a good one. The Hotel is very dark and the rooms are not maintained to any reasonable standard.The pictiures on their website makes it quite misleading. I love the location of this hotel and have stayed her many times. There are many problems with the air conditioning, internet cleanliness if the carpet and bathrooms. I will likely not return to The Empire.

Although the hotel was on the older side, our room was very comfortable and quiet. Our window overlooked Lincoln Center which was very pretty to see in the day and night. Check-in took a little longer than expected, but they did add another desk clerk which helped.

Amazing accommodations in the center of the UWS. Thanks to a 35% discount advertised on its own website, you couldn’t beat the value for the stylistic and well-appointed rooms. My wife and I stayed in a King Bed Junior Suite for her 50th birthday and celebrated with out-of-town friends at the rooftop bar that showcased amazing views of Lincoln Center and the bright lights of Broadway. In addition to the city views, the drinks, food and service was unbeatable. The drinks were perfectly mixed and the food was expertly prepared (and I’m a food snob). I highly recommend the shishito peppers, deviled eggs, pork bao buns, and baby back ribs (literally fall off the bone). After feasting on the delicious bar cuisine, you’ll feel no guilt cancelling your restaurant reservations to spend your night stop the city. The bar was hip and sleek and the style and volume of the music allowed for comfortable conversation and laughs among friends while promoting just the right ambiance. With PJ Clarke’s right outside the lobby, The Smith across the street and Rosa Mexicana around the block, there was plenty of places to eat easily right outside the doors of the hotel, But honestly, I almost didn’t want to leave my beautiful room because the bed was so comfortable that I never slept so soundly. It was an amazing weekend at the Empire Hotel!

Beside the dark hallways, smelly room, low quality bathroom. It is a good value and central location to stay. Walking distance to Hop on Hop off buses, shopping, food, and subway. Employees are very helpful and courteous.
